examples.zh: 软件更新改变了评分范围后，就需要重新标定。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。“graduation”通常是“毕业/授予学位”。因此“regraduation”字面上就是“再次毕业/重新毕业”。在日常英语里更常见的表达是：“graduate again”“re-graduate”（加连字符时更清晰）、或更具体的“requalify / regain eligibility / be re-awarded a degree”。
第二个技术义来自“graduate”也可表示“在尺上刻度/分级”，所以“regraduation”可用于“重新刻度/重新校准”。这个用法更常见于仪器、量表或评分系统的语境。

summary.en: Regraft means to graft again, usually because the first graft failed or needs replacement.
summary.zh: regraft 指“重新嫁接/再次移植”，常因第一次嫁接（或移植）失败或需要更换。

definition.en: to graft again; to attach a new scion/bud onto a plant (or a new piece of tissue onto a body) after a previous graft failed or needs replacement
definition.zh: 重新嫁接；在先前嫁接失败或需要更换时，再次把接穗/芽接到植物上（或在医学上再做移植/皮瓣移植）

examples.en: The first graft didn’t take, so the gardener decided to regraft the apple tree in early spring.
examples.zh: 第一次嫁接没有成活，所以园丁决定在早春给那棵苹果树重新嫁接。

examples.en: If the branch is damaged, you can regraft a healthy scion onto the rootstock.
examples.zh: 如果枝条受损，你可以把健康的接穗重新嫁接到砧木上。

examples.en: After complications, surgeons may need to regraft skin to help the wound heal.
examples.zh: 出现并发症后，外科医生可能需要再次进行皮肤移植来帮助伤口愈合。

extraExplanation: 主要用于园艺/果树栽培语境：regraft = re-（再一次）+ graft（嫁接）。常见搭配有 regraft a tree/branch、regraft onto a rootstock（重新接到砧木上）。
在医学语境里，graft 指“移植物/移植（皮肤、血管等）”，regraft 就是“再次移植/重新植皮”等。

summary.en: “Regrafted” means grafted again (usually a plant), or having been grafted again.
summary.zh: “Regrafted”表示“重新嫁接（植物）”，也可指“已经重新嫁接过的”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “regraft”: to graft a plant again, usually to replace a failed graft or to change the variety on the same rootstock
definition.zh: “regraft”的过去式/过去分词：再次嫁接植物，通常用于补救失败的嫁接，或在同一砧木上更换品种

examples.en: After the first graft failed, the farmer regrafted the apple tree in spring.
examples.zh: 第一次嫁接失败后，农夫在春天给那棵苹果树重新嫁接。

examples.en: The orchard was regrafted with a disease-resistant variety.
examples.zh: 果园被重新嫁接成抗病品种。

definition.en: used like an adjective: having been grafted again
definition.zh: 作形容词用：已经重新嫁接过的

examples.en: The regrafted branches began to bud within a few weeks.
examples.zh: 重新嫁接的枝条在几周内就开始发芽了。

extraExplanation: “graft/嫁接”常见于园艺：把一个品种的枝条（接穗 scion）接到另一个植株的根或茎（砧木 rootstock）上，让它们愈合成一体。regraft 往往暗示“补救”或“换品种”，比如原先接口不活、或想把树改成更好的品种。
在写作中，graft 有时也被比喻为“把一种思想/制度/风格硬接到另一种体系上”。regrafted 则可暗示“再次改造、重新拼接”。

summary.en: Regrafting means grafting again—most commonly in gardening (re-grafting a plant) and sometimes in medicine (redoing a graft).
summary.zh: Regrafting 指“再次嫁接/重新移植”，最常见于园艺，也可用于医学中“重新做移植”。

definition.en: the act of grafting a plant again (or putting a new graft onto an existing plant) to improve growth, repair damage, or change the variety
definition.zh: （园艺）再次嫁接；在原有植物上重新进行嫁接，以促进生长、修复受损或更换品种

examples.en: After the frost damaged the fruit tree, the gardener tried regrafting in spring.
examples.zh: 霜冻伤了果树后，园丁在春天尝试重新嫁接。

examples.en: Regrafting can save an old tree by adding healthier branches.
examples.zh: 重新嫁接可以通过接上更健康的枝条来拯救一棵老树。

definition.en: the act of doing a graft again in medicine (especially a skin graft) because the first one failed or needs repair
definition.zh: （医学）再次移植（尤指皮肤移植）；因第一次移植失败或需修补而重新进行移植

examples.en: The surgeon recommended regrafting after the skin graft did not fully take.
examples.zh: 皮肤移植未完全成活后，外科医生建议再次移植。

definition.en: to graft again; to attach a new part again to repair or improve something (often used in gardening)
definition.zh: 再次嫁接；重新接合新的部分以修复或改良（多用于园艺语境）

examples.en: They will regraft the tree with a disease-resistant variety.
examples.zh: 他们会把这棵树重新嫁接成抗病品种。

examples.en: If the first graft fails, you can regraft later.
examples.zh: 如果第一次嫁接失败，之后还可以再嫁接。

synonyms: replanting (not the same, but sometimes confused)
extraExplanation: “graft（嫁接）”在园艺中指把一种植物的枝条/芽（接穗 scion）接到另一株植物的根或茎（砧木 rootstock）上，让它们长成一体。regrafting 往往发生在嫁接失败、受损后修复，或想把同一棵树改成不同品种（比如更甜的苹果、抗病的葡萄）时。
在医学语境中，graft 指“移植物/移植（皮肤、骨、血管等）”。regrafting 常见于皮肤移植未完全成活（take）或需要重新覆盖创面时。

summary.en: “Regrafts” usually means “grafts again” (third-person singular of regraft), most often in gardening or farming.
summary.zh: “Regrafts”通常表示“再次嫁接”（regraft 的第三人称单数），多用于园艺或农业语境。

definition.en: (He/She/It) grafts something again; to attach a cutting/tissue to a plant (or body) a second time so it can grow or heal.
definition.zh: （他/她/它）把……再次嫁接；指把枝条/组织第二次接到植物（或身体部位）上，使其重新生长或愈合。

examples.en: The gardener regrafts the apple tree after the first graft fails.
examples.zh: 第一次嫁接失败后，园丁会把那棵苹果树再次嫁接。

examples.en: If the join dries out, the farmer regrafts it the next season.
examples.zh: 如果接口干了，农民会在下个季节重新嫁接。

definition.en: Plural noun: repeated grafts (new grafts done again), though this use is uncommon.
definition.zh: 复数名词：再次进行的嫁接（重新接上的嫁接部位），但这种名词用法不常见。

examples.en: The orchard needed several regrafts to restore the old trees.
examples.zh: 那片果园需要多次重新嫁接来恢复老树的产量。

extraExplanation: “regrafts”多见于园艺/果树栽培语境，对应动词原形是 regraft。它常用于说明“第一次嫁接未成活后再做一次”。
除了植物嫁接外，graft 也可指医学“移植/皮肤移植（skin graft）”。在医学语境里更常说 “re-graft” 或 “do another graft”，具体用法取决于专业写作习惯。

summary.en: Regrant means “grant again,” especially in official or legal contexts; it can also mean a second grant (noun).
summary.zh: regrant 指“再次授予/重新授予”，多用于法律或官方语境；也可作名词表示“二次授予”。

definition.en: to grant again; to give back (rights, property, permission, or a privilege) by a new grant, often in a legal or official way
definition.zh: 再次授予；（常指以法律/官方形式）重新授予（权利、财产、许可等）

examples.en: The city regranted the license after the company fixed the safety issues.
examples.zh: 公司解决了安全问题后，市政府重新授予了许可证。

examples.en: The land was regranted to the original owner after the court decision.
examples.zh: 法院判决后，这块土地被重新授予给原所有者。

definition.en: a new or second grant of rights, property, or authority (less common)
definition.zh: 重新授予；二次授予（较少见，用作名词）

examples.en: The agreement included a regrant of the mining rights for another ten years.
examples.zh: 协议包含将采矿权再次授予十年的条款。

extraExplanation: “regrant”多见于法律、政府文件或合同语境，强调通过新的正式文件把某项权利/许可“再授予”一次，而不只是口头同意。常与 license（执照/许可）、rights（权利）、land/property（土地/财产）等搭配。

summary.en: “Regranted” means granted again, often in formal or legal contexts (permits, rights, property).
summary.zh: “Regranted”表示“再次授予/重新批准”，常用于正式或法律语境（许可、权利、财产等）。

definition.en: given or granted again (for example, permission, a license, or a benefit) after it ended or was changed
definition.zh: 再次授予；重新批准（如许可、执照、福利等在到期或变更后又被批准）

examples.en: After the review, the city regranted the permit for another year.
examples.zh: 审查之后，市政府将许可证再次批准一年。

examples.en: The scholarship was regranted when she submitted the missing documents.
examples.zh: 她补交缺失材料后，奖学金又被重新授予。

definition.en: transferred or granted again as a legal right or property interest (often used in formal or legal writing)
definition.zh: （法律/正式用语）再次授与或转让（权利、产权或权益等）

examples.en: The land was regranted to the heir under the updated agreement.
examples.zh: 根据更新后的协议，土地被再次授与给继承人。

examples.en: The company regranted the license rights to the partner.
examples.zh: 公司将许可权再次授与合作方。

extraExplanation: “regranted”是动词“regrant”的过去式/过去分词，常见于正式通知、合同、政策文件中，强调“原先授予过—后来失效/变更—再次授予”的过程。
和“granted again”意思接近，但“regranted”更正式，尤其在涉及许可（permit/license）、权益（rights）、财产（land/estate）等场景时更常用。

summary.en: Regranting means granting something again, often used in legal, licensing, leasing, or funding contexts.
summary.zh: Regranting 指“再次授予/重新授予”，常用于法律、许可、租约或资金再分配等语境。

definition.en: the act of granting something again (especially a right, license, lease, or permission), or the process of giving it again
definition.zh: 再次授予（尤指权利、许可、租约或批准）；重新授予的行为或过程

examples.en: The committee approved the regranting of the license for another year.
examples.zh: 委员会批准将该许可证再续授一年。

examples.en: Regranting the land required new paperwork and signatures.
examples.zh: 重新授予该土地需要新的文件和签字。

definition.en: present participle of “regrant”: giving something again; granting again
definition.zh: “regrant”的现在分词：再次授予；重新授予

examples.en: The agency is regranting funds to local nonprofits this spring.
examples.zh: 该机构将在今年春天再次向当地非营利组织拨发资金。

examples.en: They are regranting the lease under updated terms.
examples.zh: 他们将按更新条款重新授予该租约。

extraExplanation: “regranting”常见于法律与行政语境，尤其是土地/房产（lease 租约、tenure 权属）、许可（license）、以及资金项目（regranting funds 指上级机构把资金再分配给下级或第三方组织）。
与“renewal（续期）”不同：renewal 更强调同一许可/合同的延长；regranting 更强调“重新授予”这一动作，可能伴随新条款、新文件或新的授予主体。

summary.en: Regrant(s) means to grant again, or a renewed/second grant (often in official or legal contexts).
summary.zh: regrant(s) 指“再次授予”，也可指“重新授予的授予书/行为”（常用于官方或法律语境）。

definition.en: to grant again; to give back a right, permission, or property after it was taken back, expired, or was previously granted
definition.zh: 再次授予；在收回、到期或曾经授予之后，再把权利、许可或财产重新授予

examples.en: The city regrants the permit each year after an inspection.
examples.zh: 城市在检查后每年都会重新授予该许可。

examples.en: The landlord regranted the lease to the same tenant.
examples.zh: 房东把租约重新授予同一位租客。

definition.en: (legal/administrative) an act of granting again; a renewed grant, especially of land or rights
definition.zh: （法律/行政）再次授予的行为；重新授予（尤指土地或权利）的授予书/授权

examples.en: The regrant confirmed the family’s right to use the land.
examples.zh: 这份重新授予文件确认了该家族对土地的使用权。

examples.en: Records show several regrants after the boundary changed.
examples.zh: 记录显示边界变更后有过多次重新授予。

extraExplanation: “regrant(s)”常见于政府、学校基金、土地与不动产、以及许可/执照管理等语境，带有较强的正式或法律色彩。
形式说明：regrants 既可以是动词第三人称单数（He regrants…），也可以是名词复数（several regrants）。

summary.en: Regraph means to make a graph again or replot data in a new/clearer way.
summary.zh: regraph 指把图表重新绘制，或将数据用新的/更清晰的方式重新作图。

definition.en: to draw a graph again, or to plot the same data on a new/updated graph (often with different scales, labels, or methods)
definition.zh: 重新绘制图表；把同一组数据用新的/更新的方式重新作图（常指更改比例、标注或绘图方法）

examples.en: The professor asked us to regraph the data using a logarithmic scale.
examples.zh: 教授让我们用对数坐标把数据重新作图。

examples.en: If the points look messy, regraph them with clearer axis labels.
examples.zh: 如果点看起来很乱，就把坐标轴标注写清楚再重新作图。

examples.en: After fixing the error in the table, I regraphed the results.
examples.zh: 修正表格里的错误后，我把结果重新绘制成图。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次/重新”，加在“graph（图表；作图）”前面，构成“regraph”。这个词多见于数学、统计、理科作业或数据分析语境里，属于较专业、较少在日常口语中单独使用的动词。

summary.en: Regrasp means to grasp something again (often to adjust your grip), and sometimes figuratively to understand something again in a new way.
summary.zh: Regrasp 指“重新抓住/重新握住”（常为调整握法更稳），也可比喻“重新把握、重新理解”。

definition.en: to grasp (hold) something again, often to adjust your grip for better control
definition.zh: 再次抓住/重新握住（常指为了调整握法、抓得更稳）

examples.en: He regrasped the rope before climbing higher.
examples.zh: 他重新握紧绳子，再往上爬。

examples.en: Regrasp the hammer closer to the head for more precision.
examples.zh: 把锤子靠近锤头处重新握住，会更精准。

definition.en: (figurative) to take hold of an idea again; to understand or approach it in a new way
definition.zh: （比喻）重新把握某个想法；用新的方式重新理解或处理

examples.en: After reading the last chapter, she regrasped the author’s main point.
examples.zh: 读完最后一章后，她重新把握了作者的主旨。

examples.en: We need to regrasp the basics before moving on.
examples.zh: 继续之前，我们需要重新掌握基础。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再、重新”。“regrasp”在日常口语中不如“grasp again / get a better grip”常见，但在说明书、运动训练、攀爬/器械操作等语境里很自然。

summary.en: Regrass means to plant grass again or for grass to grow back, usually to restore a lawn or ground cover.
summary.zh: regrass 指重新种草或重新长出草，通常用于恢复草坪或地面草覆盖。

definition.en: to plant grass again on an area of ground (especially a lawn or slope) to restore grass cover
definition.zh: （在某块地上）重新种草、补种草（常指草坪或坡面，以恢复草覆盖）

examples.en: After the construction work, we regrassed the yard to stop the soil from washing away.
examples.zh: 施工结束后，我们重新给院子种草，以防止土壤被冲走。

examples.en: The park department plans to regrass the damaged field in early spring.
examples.zh: 公园管理部门计划在早春为受损的草地重新种草。

definition.en: to become covered with grass again; for grass to grow back in an area
definition.zh: （某处）重新长出草、恢复草覆盖

examples.en: With enough rain, the hillside will regrass naturally over time.
examples.zh: 如果雨水充足，山坡会随着时间自然重新长出草来。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次、重新”。“regrass”多见于园林维护、运动场地修复、道路边坡绿化与水土保持等语境中。常见搭配有：regrass a lawn / regrass a field / regrass the slope。

summary.en: Regret means feeling sorry about something in the past, or the feeling itself; it’s also used politely in formal messages (e.g., “We regret to inform…”).
summary.zh: Regret 指对过去的事感到后悔/遗憾，或这种情绪本身；也常用于正式语境表达歉意（如“很遗憾通知…”）。

definition.en: to feel sorry about something you did or did not do; to wish it had been different
definition.zh: 对自己做过或没做的事感到后悔；希望事情当时能不一样

examples.en: I regret saying that during the argument.
examples.zh: 我后悔在争吵时说了那句话。

examples.en: She regrets not studying harder in college.
examples.zh: 她后悔大学时没有更努力学习。

examples.en: Do you regret your decision?
examples.zh: 你后悔你的决定吗？

definition.en: a feeling of sadness or disappointment about something, especially a past action or loss
definition.zh: （尤指对过去行为或失去的事的）遗憾、后悔之情

examples.en: He spoke with regret about the missed chance.
examples.zh: 他谈到错过的机会时语气里满是遗憾。

examples.en: My only regret is that I didn’t call sooner.
examples.zh: 我唯一的遗憾是没有早点打电话。

definition.en: used in polite, formal messages to express bad news or refusal (often plural: “regrets”)
definition.zh: （正式、礼貌用语）用于表达歉意的坏消息或婉拒（常用复数 regrets）

examples.en: We regret to inform you that your application was not successful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾地通知您，您的申请未通过。

examples.en: She sent her regrets because she couldn’t attend the wedding.
examples.zh: 她因无法参加婚礼而致以歉意（托人转达）。

extraExplanation: 你写的 **regrate** 通常是拼写错误，正确拼写是 **regret**。
常见搭配：**regret doing**（后悔做过…）；**regret to do**（很遗憾要去做/告知…，多用于正式场合）。

summary.en: “Regretted” means you felt sorry about something (past of “regret”), or describes something seen as unfortunate.
summary.zh: “Regretted” 指“后悔了/感到遗憾”（regret 的过去式/过去分词），也可作形容词表示“令人遗憾的”。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “regret”: to feel sorry about something you did or did not do, or to wish it had not happened
definition.zh: “regret”的过去式和过去分词：对做过/没做的事感到后悔；希望某事没有发生

examples.en: She regretted saying those words in anger.
examples.zh: 她后悔自己在气头上说了那些话。

examples.en: I regretted not studying harder for the exam.
examples.zh: 我后悔没有为考试更努力学习。

definition.en: feeling sorrow or disappointment about something; showing regret (often used in formal writing)
definition.zh: 感到遗憾/后悔的；表示歉意的（常见于较正式的表达）

examples.en: He gave a regretted apology for the mistake.
examples.zh: 他为这个错误表达了遗憾并道歉。

examples.en: It was a regretted decision in the end.
examples.zh: 最终那是一个令人遗憾的决定。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 “regrated” 常见是拼写错误，通常想写的是 “regretted”（后悔了/感到遗憾）。正确拼写里有两个 t：regret → regretted。

summary.en: “Regrater” is not standard; the likely word is “regretter,” meaning a person who feels regret.
summary.zh: “regrater”不是标准拼写；更可能是“regretter”，意思是“会感到后悔/遗憾的人”。

definition.en: Nonstandard spelling. You probably mean “regretter”: a person who feels regret.
definition.zh: 非标准拼写。你可能想写的是 “regretter”：指感到后悔/遗憾的人。

examples.en: He’s not a regretter—he learns from mistakes and moves on.
examples.zh: 他不是那种总后悔的人——他会从错误中学习，然后继续前进。

examples.en: I’m a regretter when I don’t speak up in meetings.
examples.zh: 当我在会议上不敢发言时，我就会变得很后悔。

extraExplanation: “regrater”在现代英语里几乎不用作标准词。最常见的目标词是“regretter”（后悔的人），来自动词/名词“regret”（后悔；遗憾）。
如果你本来想表达“后悔/遗憾”这个动作或感受，更自然的用法通常是“regret”作动词：I regret saying that.（我后悔说了那句话。）或作名词：No regrets.（不后悔。）

summary.en: Regret means feeling sorry or disappointed about something in the past; it can also be used politely to give bad news.
summary.zh: Regret 指对过去的事感到后悔或遗憾；也可用于正式场合礼貌地表达“很遗憾……”

definition.en: a feeling of sadness or disappointment about something that happened or something you did (or didn’t do)
definition.zh: 对已经发生的事、做过（或没做）的事感到难过或失望的情绪；后悔

examples.en: I have no regrets about moving to a new city.
examples.zh: 我对搬到新城市这件事不后悔。

examples.en: Her biggest regret is not studying harder in school.
examples.zh: 她最大的遗憾是当年没有更努力学习。

definition.en: to feel sorry about something you did or a situation that happened
definition.zh: 为（做过的事或发生的情况）感到后悔；遗憾

examples.en: I regret saying that—I didn’t mean it.
examples.zh: 我后悔说了那句话——我不是那个意思。

examples.en: You won’t regret taking this opportunity.
examples.zh: 你不会后悔抓住这次机会的。

definition.en: (polite/formal) to say that you are sorry to give bad news or to refuse a request
definition.zh: （礼貌/正式）很遗憾地告知坏消息或拒绝请求

examples.en: We regret to inform you that your application was unsuccessful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾地通知您，您的申请未通过。

examples.en: I regret that I can’t attend the meeting tomorrow.
examples.zh: 很遗憾我明天不能参加会议。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **regrates** 常见于拼写错误；正确拼写通常是 **regrets**（名词复数）或 **regret**（动词/名词单数）。
常见搭配：**regret doing**（后悔做过某事） vs **regret to do**（遗憾要去做某事，常用于正式通知）。

summary.en: Regratification is a rare term meaning renewed or repeated gratification (satisfaction/pleasure).
summary.zh: Regratification 是个罕见词，指“重新/再次获得的满足与愉悦”。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) A renewed feeling of pleasure or satisfaction; gratification experienced again.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）再次获得的满足感或愉悦；重新体验到的满足。

examples.en: Hearing the old song gave her a sense of regratification.
examples.zh: 听到那首老歌让她再次感到一种满足。

examples.en: He felt regratification when his effort was finally recognized a second time.
examples.zh: 当他的努力再次得到认可时，他又感到满足。

definition.en: (Rare) The act of gratifying again; giving someone pleasure or satisfaction again.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次使人满足/愉悦的行为；再度给予满足。

examples.en: The team aimed for regratification of loyal customers with improved service.
examples.zh: 团队希望通过改进服务再次让忠实顾客感到满意。

examples.en: Small gestures can bring regratification to a tired friendship.
examples.zh: 一些小举动能为疲惫的友谊带来重新的满足感。

extraExplanation: “regratification”并不是常见词，很多英语使用者可能从未见过。它看起来是由前缀 re-（“再次”）+ gratification（“满足；使满足”）构成的“临时造词/生造词”。在正式写作中，更自然的表达通常是 renewed gratification、a renewed sense of satisfaction，或直接说 feel gratified again（“再次感到满足”）。

summary.en: Regratify means to please or satisfy again (a rare word).
summary.zh: regratify 指“再次使满足/取悦”（用法较少见）。

definition.en: to gratify again; to please or satisfy someone once more (rare).
definition.zh: 再次使满足；再一次取悦或满足某人（较罕见）。

examples.en: The surprise gift was meant to regratify her after a hard week.
examples.zh: 这份惊喜礼物是为了在她辛苦一周后再次让她开心。

examples.en: He tried to regratify the guests with a second round of desserts.
examples.zh: 他用第二轮甜点来再次取悦客人。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，很多时候会被当作不常用或临时造词（nonce word）。日常写作更常用表达是："gratify again"、"please again"、"satisfy again"。
构词上是 re-（再、重新）+ gratify（使满足/取悦）。在正式写作中，如果担心读者不认识，建议改用更常见的说法。

summary.en: “Regretting” means feeling sorry about something in the past, or (formally) expressing that you are sorry to say something.
summary.zh: “Regretting”表示对过去的事感到后悔；也可在正式语境中表示“遗憾地……”。

definition.en: feeling sorry about something you did or did not do; wishing it had been different
definition.zh: 对做过或没做过的事感到后悔；希望当时情况不一样

examples.en: I’m regretting my decision to stay up so late.
examples.zh: 我在后悔自己熬夜熬到那么晚的决定。

examples.en: She’s regretting not studying harder for the test.
examples.zh: 她后悔没有更努力地准备考试。

definition.en: politely saying you are sorry (often used in formal messages)
definition.zh: （较正式）用来表达遗憾/抱歉

examples.en: We are regretting to inform you that your application was not successful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾地通知您，您的申请未通过。

examples.en: He wrote, regretting the inconvenience caused.
examples.zh: 他写道，对造成的不便表示遗憾。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“regrating”通常是拼写错误。最常见的正确拼写是“regretting”（来自动词 regret）。注意：regret 里有两个 t，所以现在分词也写成 regretting（双写 t + ing）。
用法提醒：在日常英语里更常说“regret doing something”（后悔做过某事），例如：I regret saying that.；而“regret to say/inform”（遗憾地说/通知）更正式、更书面。

summary.en: “Regrettingly” means “with regret; feeling sorry about something.”
summary.zh: “Regrettingly”表示“带着遗憾/后悔地；很抱歉地”。

definition.en: In a way that shows you feel sorry about something or wish it had not happened; with regret.
definition.zh: 带着遗憾地；后悔地（表示对某事感到抱歉或希望它没发生）。

examples.en: I regrettingly declined the invitation because I had to work late.
examples.zh: 我很遗憾地拒绝了邀请，因为我必须加班。

examples.en: She looked at the old photo, regrettingly remembering what she had lost.
examples.zh: 她看着那张旧照片，带着遗憾回想起自己失去的东西。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **regratingly** 很可能是拼写错误，正确拼写通常是 **regrettingly**（来自 regret + -ingly）。在正式写作中也常用更自然的表达，如 **with regret**（“遗憾地”）或 **regretfully**（语气更常见）。

summary.en: “Regrator” is likely a misspelling of “refrigerator,” meaning a fridge used to keep food and drinks cold.
summary.zh: “regrator”很可能是“refrigerator（冰箱）”的拼写错误，指用来冷藏食物和饮料的冰箱。

definition.en: a machine or cabinet that keeps food and drinks cold so they stay fresh longer
definition.zh: 冰箱；冷藏柜（用来冷却食物和饮料以延长保鲜时间的机器或柜子）

examples.en: Put the milk back in the refrigerator.
examples.zh: 把牛奶放回冰箱里。

examples.en: Our refrigerator is making a strange noise.
examples.zh: 我们的冰箱在发出奇怪的声音。

extraExplanation: “regrator”不是常见英文单词；最可能是把 **refrigerator**（冰箱）拼错了。日常口语里更常说 **fridge**（/frɪdʒ/），意思相同。
注意拼写：**refrigerator** 里有 “**refri-**” 和 “**-ger-**”，中间的 **dʒ** 音让很多学习者容易漏字母或写错顺序。
在美式英语中，**fridge** 是最自然的口语表达；更正式或书面场合用 **refrigerator**。旧式用法还有 **icebox**（现在多带复古/历史感）。

summary.en: Regress means to go back to an earlier or worse state (verb) or such a backward change (noun).
summary.zh: Regress 指回到较早或更差的状态（动词），也可指这种倒退的变化（名词）。

definition.en: to return to an earlier or less developed state; to go backward instead of improving
definition.zh: 回到较早或较不发展的状态；（发展上）倒退、退化

examples.en: After the injury, he regressed and needed help walking again.
examples.zh: 受伤后，他状态倒退，又需要人帮忙走路了。

examples.en: Some countries worry that human rights could regress during a crisis.
examples.zh: 一些国家担心在危机期间人权会倒退。

definition.en: to go back to a previous topic, place, or earlier point in a discussion
definition.zh: 回到（之前的话题、地点或论述点）；回溯

examples.en: Let’s regress to your earlier question about the budget.
examples.zh: 我们回到你刚才关于预算的问题。

definition.en: a return to an earlier or worse condition; a loss of progress
definition.zh: 倒退；退步；（情况）变差

examples.en: There was a regress in sales last quarter.
examples.zh: 上个季度销量出现了下滑。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“regratress”不是常见英文单词，最可能想写的是 **regress**（倒退/回溯）。如果你原意是“后悔”，常用词是 **regret**。你也可以告诉我你想表达的中文意思，我可以帮你确认正确拼写。

summary.en: “Regravel” means to add gravel again to a road, driveway, or other surface.
summary.zh: “regravel”指在道路、车道等表面再次铺上碎石。

definition.en: to put a new layer of gravel on a surface again (especially a road, driveway, or path)
definition.zh: （尤指道路、车道或小路）重新铺上一层碎石；再铺碎石

examples.en: The county plans to regravel the rural roads after the heavy rains.
examples.zh: 大雨过后，县里计划把乡村道路重新铺碎石。

examples.en: We need to regravel the driveway because the old gravel has washed away.
examples.zh: 我们得把车道重新铺碎石，因为旧碎石被水冲走了。

examples.en: They regraveled the parking area to improve drainage.
examples.zh: 他们把停车区域重新铺碎石来改善排水。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再、重新”，加在动词前常表示重复动作（如 rebuild 重新建造，repave 重新铺路）。
regravel 多见于工程、维修、农村道路养护等语境；日常口语里也可能说 “put down more gravel / add more gravel”。

summary.en: “Regrease” means to put grease on something again for maintenance.
summary.zh: “Regrease”指为保养而给某物重新加润滑脂/再上油。

definition.en: to apply grease again to a machine or part, usually to reduce friction or prevent wear
definition.zh: （给机器或零件）重新加润滑脂；再上油（通常为减少摩擦或防止磨损）

examples.en: After cleaning the bearings, regrease them before putting the machine back together.
examples.zh: 清洁轴承后，重新加润滑脂，再把机器装回去。

examples.en: The maintenance guide says to regrease the joints every six months.
examples.zh: 维护手册说每六个月要给接头重新上润滑脂。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加在动词前很常见（如 rebuild 重新建造、repaint 重新刷漆）。因此 regrease 多用于维修、保养语境，常见搭配有 regrease the bearings/joints/gears（给轴承/接头/齿轮重新加脂）。另外，日常口语里也常用 grease as a verb（给……上油/上脂），regrease 强调“再一次”。

summary.en: Regreased means grease was applied again to improve movement and protect parts.
summary.zh: Regreased 指“重新上润滑脂/再加油脂”，让部件更顺畅并起保护作用。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “regrease”: to apply grease again to a machine part so it moves smoothly and is protected.
definition.zh: “regrease”的过去式/过去分词：给机器部件再次上润滑脂，使其运转更顺畅并起到保护作用。

examples.en: We regreased the bike chain after riding in the rain.
examples.zh: 雨天骑行后，我们给自行车链条重新上了润滑脂。

examples.en: The technician regreased the bearings to stop the squeaking.
examples.zh: 技术员给轴承重新加了润滑脂，吱吱声就消失了。

definition.en: to make something oily or slippery again by adding grease.
definition.zh: 再度变得油腻/滑溜（通过添加油脂）。

examples.en: Be careful—someone regreased the pan and it’s very slippery.
examples.zh: 小心点——有人把平底锅又抹了油，现在很滑。

extraExplanation: “regreased”多见于维修/保养语境（自行车链条、轴承、齿轮、门铰链等）。它强调“再次”加润滑脂，通常是因为原来的润滑被雨水、灰尘或高温影响而失效。
日常写作里也常用更口语的表达：“greased it again / put more grease on it”。

summary.en: Regreasing means applying grease again to keep parts moving smoothly and prevent wear.
summary.zh: Regreasing 指给部件再次加润滑脂，使其运转顺畅并减少磨损。

definition.en: the act of applying grease again to a machine part to reduce friction and wear
definition.zh: （对机械部件）再次加润滑脂，以减少摩擦与磨损的行为

examples.en: Regular regreasing keeps the bearings running smoothly.
examples.zh: 定期重新加脂能让轴承运转更顺畅。

examples.en: After washing the bike, she did some regreasing on the chain and pedals.
examples.zh: 洗完自行车后，她给链条和脚踏做了重新加脂。

definition.en: applying grease again to a part or surface; re-lubricating
definition.zh: 给部件或表面再次涂抹润滑脂；重新润滑

examples.en: We’re regreasing the hinges because they started squeaking.
examples.zh: 我们在给铰链重新加脂，因为它们开始吱吱响了。

examples.en: The mechanic recommended regreasing the wheel hubs every year.
examples.zh: 修理工建议每年给轮毂重新加脂一次。

examples.en: If water gets inside, regreasing helps protect the metal from rust.
examples.zh: 如果进了水，重新加脂能帮助保护金属防锈。

extraExplanation: “Regreasing”来自动词“regrease”（re- 表示“再次” + grease 表示“润滑脂”）。常见于维修保养语境，如轴承、铰链、链条、齿轮、轮毂等。
日常表达里也常用“re-lubricate / relubricating”（重新润滑）。如果用的是油而不是脂，可能会说“re-oil”（重新上油）。

summary.en: “regrede” is likely a misspelling of “regret,” meaning to feel sorry about something, or the feeling itself.
summary.zh: “regrede”很可能是“regret”的拼写错误；regret表示“后悔/遗憾”，也可表示“后悔的情绪”。

definition.en: If you meant **regret**: to feel sorry about something you did or something that happened.
definition.zh: 如果你想写的是 **regret**：对自己做过的事或发生的事感到后悔/遗憾。

examples.en: I regret saying those words.
examples.zh: 我后悔说了那些话。

examples.en: She regrets not studying harder.
examples.zh: 她后悔没有更努力学习。

examples.en: Do you regret your decision?
examples.zh: 你后悔你的决定吗？

definition.en: **Regret**: a feeling of sadness or disappointment about something you did or something that happened.
definition.zh: **regret**：对自己做过的事或发生的事感到后悔/遗憾的情绪。

examples.en: He felt deep regret after the argument.
examples.zh: 争吵后他感到深深的懊悔。

examples.en: My only regret is not traveling earlier.
examples.zh: 我唯一的遗憾是没有更早去旅行。

definition.en: A polite, formal way to say you are sorry (often used in emails/announcements).
definition.zh: （正式用语）用于礼貌表达“抱歉/遗憾”，常见于邮件或公告。

examples.en: We regret to inform you that your application was unsuccessful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾通知你，你的申请未通过。

examples.en: I regret that I can’t attend the meeting.
examples.zh: 我很遗憾我无法参加会议。

extraExplanation: “regrede”在英语里通常不是标准拼写，最常见是把 **regret** 拼错了。也可能是想写 **regretted**（过去式/过去分词）或 **regretful**（形容词：后悔的）。
常见搭配：**regret doing**（后悔做过某事）；**regret to do**（遗憾地要去做某事，常用于正式通知）。

summary.en: Regreen means to turn green again or to make something green again, especially plants or grass.
summary.zh: Regreen 指（植物、草地等）重新变绿，或使其重新变绿。

definition.en: to become green again after a dry, cold, or damaged period; to turn green again
definition.zh: （在干旱、寒冷或受损后）重新变绿；再度转绿

examples.en: After the spring rains, the hills began to regreen.
examples.zh: 春雨过后，山坡开始重新变绿。

examples.en: The lawn will regreen if you water it regularly.
examples.zh: 如果你规律浇水，草坪会重新变绿。

definition.en: to make something green again, especially grass or plants
definition.zh: 使（草地、植物等）重新变绿

examples.en: They regreened the park by improving the soil and planting native grasses.
examples.zh: 他们通过改良土壤并种植本地草种，让公园重新变绿。

examples.en: A bit of fertilizer can help regreen yellowing leaves.
examples.zh: 一点肥料能帮助发黄的叶子重新变绿。

extraExplanation: “regreen”常见于自然写作、园艺与环保语境：描述季节回暖、降雨后植被恢复，或城市/社区“再绿化”（让环境重新更有绿意）。相比更正式的表达（如“revegetate / restore vegetation”），它更口语、更形象。

summary.en: Regreens means becomes green again or makes something green again.
summary.zh: regreens 表示“重新变绿/返青”，也可表示“使……重新变绿”。

definition.en: to become green again, especially after winter, drought, or damage
definition.zh: （尤指在冬季、干旱或受损后）重新变绿、返青

examples.en: After the spring rains, the hills regreened quickly.
examples.zh: 春雨过后，山丘很快就返青了。

examples.en: The lawn regreens in April in many parts of the U.S.
examples.zh: 在美国许多地区，草坪常在四月返青。

definition.en: to make something green again; to restore plants/land to a healthy green state
definition.zh: 使……重新变绿；使植被/土地恢复绿意

examples.en: The city planted trees to regreen the neighborhood.
examples.zh: 城市通过植树让社区重新恢复绿意。

examples.en: New irrigation helped regreen the dry fields.
examples.zh: 新的灌溉方式帮助干旱的田地重新变绿。

extraExplanation: “regreens”通常是动词“regreen”的第三人称单数（he/she/it regreens）或名词复数形式（较少见）。
构词上是 re-（再次）+ green（绿色/变绿），常用于描写自然季节变化（如春天返青）或环保语境（让城市/土地重新变绿）。

summary.en: “Regreet” means to greet someone again.
summary.zh: “regreet”表示“再次问候/再次打招呼”。

definition.en: to greet someone again (for example, after you have already greeted them earlier, or when you meet them a second time)
definition.zh: 再次向某人打招呼；再度问候（例如之前已问候过，后来又遇到）

examples.en: After the meeting, I regreeted the clients in the lobby.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，我在大厅又一次向客户打招呼。

examples.en: When I returned to the room, I regreeted everyone politely.
examples.zh: 我回到房间时，又礼貌地向大家再次致意。

extraExplanation: “regreet”由前缀 re-（表示“再、重新”）+ greet（问候）构成，但在日常英语中并不常用。更自然的说法常是：greet someone again / say hello again / greet them once more。

summary.en: “Regreeted” means “greeted again.”
summary.zh: “regreeted”意为“再次问候/又打招呼”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “regreet”: greeted someone again (often after a short separation or in a repeated meeting).
definition.zh: “regreet”的过去式/过去分词：再次问候（常用于短暂分开后或重复见面时）。

examples.en: After stepping out to take a call, she regreeted the guests when she returned.
examples.zh: 她出去接了个电话，回来后又再次向客人们问候。

examples.en: We regreeted each other at the conference the next day.
examples.zh: 第二天在会议上，我们又互相打了招呼。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。因此 regreet = greet again（再次问候）。这个词在日常口语中不算常见，更多时候人们会说 “greeted again” 或 “said hello again”。

summary.en: Regreeting means greeting someone again, or a second greeting.
summary.zh: regreeting 指“再次问候/再打招呼”，也可指“第二次的问候”。

definition.en: The act of greeting someone again; a second greeting.
definition.zh: 再次问候；第二次打招呼。

examples.en: After the meeting, their quick regreeting in the hallway felt warm and friendly.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，他们在走廊里又快速地互相问候了一次，感觉很温暖友好。

examples.en: A simple nod can be a regreeting when you see the same person twice in one day.
examples.zh: 如果你一天里两次见到同一个人，一个简单的点头也可以算是再次问候。

definition.en: To greet someone again.
definition.zh: 再次向（某人）问候；再次打招呼。

examples.en: He regreeted his neighbors when he ran into them at the grocery store.
examples.zh: 他在杂货店偶遇邻居时又跟他们打了招呼。

examples.en: When you re-enter the room, it’s polite to regreet everyone briefly.
examples.zh: 当你重新进到房间里时，简单地再跟大家打个招呼会比较礼貌。

extraExplanation: “regreeting”不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的表达是“greet again / say hello again / greet someone a second time”。在写作中用“regreeting”会显得更书面或更少见。
相关词：regreet（动词）更自然；“re-greeting”有时会写成带连字符的形式，用来强调“再次问候”。

summary.en: “regreets” (rare) means “greets again,” or it can be the third-person singular form of “regreet.”
summary.zh: “regreets”（少见）表示“再次问候/再次打招呼”，也可指动词“regreet”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (rare) to greet again; to greet someone a second time, often when meeting again or returning.
definition.zh: （少见）再次问候；在再次见面或对方返回时再打招呼。

examples.en: When she came back into the room, he regreets her with a smile.
examples.zh: 她回到房间时，他微笑着再次向她打招呼。

examples.en: The host regreets the guests as they return from the garden.
examples.zh: 客人从花园回来时，主人又再次迎接问候。

definition.en: Third-person singular present form of “regreet.”
definition.zh: 动词“regreet”的第三人称单数现在时形式。

examples.en: He regreets everyone at the door after the break.
examples.zh: 休息后，他在门口再次向每个人问候。

extraExplanation: “regreet(s)”在现代英语里非常不常见；更自然的表达通常是“greet again / greet (someone) again / welcome back”。
有时也会写成带连字符的“re-greet(s)”，用来强调“再次”的含义。
注意别和常见词“regrets”（后悔）混淆：regrets /rɪˈɡrɛts/ 与 regreets /ˌriˈɡrits/ 拼写和发音都不同。

summary.en: Regress means to go back to an earlier state—often to worsen; in statistics, it means to run a regression analysis.
summary.zh: Regress 指回到更早的状态，常含“退步/倒退”之意；在统计学中指进行“回归分析”。

definition.en: To return to an earlier or less developed state, behavior, or way of thinking (often a negative change).
definition.zh: （常指变差）退回到更早期或较不成熟的状态、行为或思维方式。

examples.en: After a few good weeks, he regressed and started missing deadlines again.
examples.zh: 顺利了几周后，他又退步了，开始再次错过截止日期。

examples.en: Under stress, some people regress to childish habits like sulking or crying easily.
examples.zh: 在压力下，有些人会退回到更幼稚的习惯，比如闹情绪或容易哭。

definition.en: To go back to a previous place, condition, or level.
definition.zh: 回到先前的地点、状况或水平。

examples.en: The discussion regressed to the same old arguments.
examples.zh: 讨论又回到了老一套的争论。

examples.en: If the system fails, the software may regress to a default setting.
examples.zh: 如果系统出故障，软件可能会回退到默认设置。

definition.en: (Statistics) To model or estimate how one variable changes in relation to others; to perform regression analysis.
definition.zh: （统计）用回归分析建立模型，估计一个变量与其他变量之间的关系。

examples.en: The researchers regressed test scores on study time and sleep quality.
examples.zh: 研究人员用学习时间和睡眠质量来回归分析考试成绩。

examples.en: We regressed sales against advertising spending to see the relationship.
examples.zh: 我们把销售额对广告支出做回归分析，以观察两者关系。

extraExplanation: “regress”在日常英语里通常带有“退步、倒退”的负面含义；而在统计学里是中性术语，指“回归（分析）”。
常见搭配：regress to (a state/behavior)（退回到某种状态/行为）；regress into (bad habits)（又陷入坏习惯）。

summary.en: Regressed means “went back” to an earlier/worse state, or (in statistics) was analyzed using regression.
summary.zh: Regressed 指“倒退/回到较早或更差的状态”，也可指（统计中）“做回归分析”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of regress) to return to an earlier or less developed state; to become worse after improving.
definition.zh: （regress 的过去式/过去分词）回到较早或较不发展的状态；在改善后又变差、倒退。

examples.en: After a few good weeks, his symptoms regressed.
examples.zh: 好转了几周后，他的症状又倒退了。

examples.en: The company regressed to old habits when the pressure increased.
examples.zh: 压力一增大，公司又回到了老毛病。

definition.en: In statistics/science: analyzed using regression (a method for modeling relationships between variables).
definition.zh: （统计/科研）用回归方法进行分析（用来建立变量之间关系的模型）。

examples.en: The researchers regressed income on education level and age.
examples.zh: 研究人员用教育水平和年龄来对收入做回归分析。

examples.en: We regressed the test scores against study time.
examples.zh: 我们把考试分数与学习时间做回归分析。

definition.en: (adjective use) having returned to an earlier or less mature state; showing regression.
definition.zh: （形容词用法）倒退的；退化的；回到较早阶段的。

examples.en: She showed regressed behavior when she felt unsafe.
examples.zh: 当她感到不安全时，会表现出倒退性的行为。

extraExplanation: “regress / regressed”在心理学里常说“退行（regression）”，指人在压力或创伤下出现更像儿童时期的行为（例如更依赖、爱哭）。这是描述现象的用语，不一定带有贬义。
统计学里“regress A on B”是常见搭配：把A当作要解释/预测的结果（因变量），B当作解释因素（自变量）。

summary.en: “Regresses” means “goes back” to an earlier or worse state; it can also mean “moves backward,” or (in statistics) “runs a regression analysis.”
summary.zh: “regresses”表示“倒退/退回到较早或更糟的状态”；也可指“后退”，或（统计中）“进行回归分析”。

definition.en: (of a person, behavior, or situation) to return to an earlier, less developed, or worse state.
definition.zh: （人、行为或情况）倒退；退回到较早、更不成熟或更糟的状态。

examples.en: When he’s under stress, he regresses and starts acting like a child.
examples.zh: 当他压力大时，他会退行，开始像小孩一样行事。

examples.en: After a few good weeks, her sleep schedule regresses.
examples.zh: 在连续几周不错之后，她的作息又倒退了。

definition.en: (formal) to move backward; to go back to a previous position or stage.
definition.zh: （正式）后退；回到先前的位置或阶段。

examples.en: Instead of making progress, the discussion regresses to old arguments.
examples.zh: 讨论不但没有推进，反而退回到老争论上。

examples.en: The camera slowly regresses to the starting point.
examples.zh: 镜头慢慢后移回到起点。

definition.en: (statistics) to use regression analysis to estimate a relationship between variables (e.g., outcomes and predictors).
definition.zh: （统计）用回归分析来估计变量之间的关系（如结果与预测因素）。

examples.en: The researcher regresses income on education and work experience.
examples.zh: 研究者将收入对教育和工作经验做回归分析。

examples.en: She regresses test scores on study time.
examples.zh: 她用学习时间来回归解释考试分数。

extraExplanation: “regresses”是动词“regress”的第三人称单数（he/she/it regresses）。常见搭配：regress to…（退回到……状态/阶段）。
在心理学语境里，regress/退行常指人在压力、创伤下出现更幼稚或更依赖的行为方式，这是很常见的描述用法。
在统计语境里，“regress A on B”是固定说法，意思是“用B来解释/预测A”（把A作为因变量，把B作为自变量）。日常英语中不常用这一义项，但在学术写作里很常见。

summary.en: Regressing means going back to an earlier (often worse) state; in statistics, it means performing a regression analysis.
summary.zh: Regressing 指回到较早（常更差）的状态、倒退；在统计中指进行回归分析。

definition.en: (of a situation, condition, or progress) returning to an earlier or worse state; going backward instead of improving.
definition.zh: （指情况、状态或进展）回到较早或更差的状态；倒退、退步。

examples.en: After the new policy, the project was regressing instead of moving forward.
examples.zh: 新政策出台后，项目不是前进而是在倒退。

examples.en: Her symptoms are regressing with the new treatment.
examples.zh: 在新疗法下，她的症状正在减轻、逐渐好转（向早期较轻状态回退）。

definition.en: The present participle of “regress”: to go back to an earlier stage, state, or behavior.
definition.zh: “regress”的现在分词：回到较早的阶段、状态或行为；退回、退化。

examples.en: When he feels stressed, he starts regressing to old habits.
examples.zh: 当他感到压力时，就会开始退回到旧习惯。

examples.en: The conversation kept regressing to the same argument.
examples.zh: 谈话不断回到同一个争论点上。

definition.en: In statistics/data science: fitting a regression model (e.g., regressing one variable on another) to study relationships between variables.
definition.zh: 在统计/数据分析中：进行回归分析（例如把一个变量对另一个变量做回归）以研究变量关系。

examples.en: They are regressing sales on advertising spending to estimate the effect.
examples.zh: 他们在做“销售额对广告支出”的回归，以估计影响。

examples.en: We’re regressing test scores on study time and sleep.
examples.zh: 我们在做“考试成绩对学习时间和睡眠”的回归。

extraExplanation: “regress”常带有“变差、倒退”的语气：progress（进步） ↔ regress（倒退）。
心理学里也会说“regress to childlike behavior”（退行到更幼稚的行为），常用于压力或创伤情境。
统计语境中，“regress A on B”常译为“A对B做回归”，表示用B来解释/预测A。

summary.en: Regression usually means a backward move or return to an earlier state; in psychology it’s a return to earlier behavior under stress; in statistics it’s a modeling method for relationships between variables.
summary.zh: Regression 通常指“倒退/回到早期状态”；在心理学中指压力下回到早期行为；在统计学中指用来建模变量关系的“回归”。

definition.en: A return to an earlier, less developed, or less successful state or condition; a move backward instead of forward.
definition.zh: 回到较早期、较不成熟或较差的状态；倒退。

examples.en: After a week without practice, her progress showed some regression.
examples.zh: 一周没练习后，她的进步出现了一些倒退。

examples.en: The company’s customer service is in regression compared to last year.
examples.zh: 和去年相比，这家公司的客服在走下坡路。

definition.en: In psychology, a return to earlier behaviors or ways of thinking, especially under stress.
definition.zh: （心理学）在压力下退回到较早期的行为或思维方式。

examples.en: Under stress, he experienced regression and started acting like a child.
examples.zh: 在压力下，他出现退行，开始像小孩一样行事。

examples.en: Therapy helped her understand why regression happens during conflict.
examples.zh: 治疗帮助她理解为什么冲突时会出现退行。

definition.en: In statistics, a method used to model or predict the relationship between variables (for example, how one factor affects another).
definition.zh: （统计学）回归：用来建立或预测变量之间关系的方法（例如一个因素如何影响另一个）。

examples.en: We used linear regression to predict housing prices from location and size.
examples.zh: 我们用线性回归根据地段和面积来预测房价。

examples.en: Regression analysis can show which factors matter most.
examples.zh: 回归分析可以显示哪些因素最重要。

extraExplanation: “regression”在学术语境里很常见：心理学多指“退行（行为退回）”，统计/数据科学里指“回归（建模方法）”。日常口语里更常用“a setback（挫折/倒退）”或“backslide（倒退）”。
词源上来自拉丁语 regredi（向后走），所以核心意象是“往回走/走回去”。当你看到“regress”这个动词（vi.）时，意思就是“倒退；退回”。

summary.en: “Regressionist” means a person (or idea) that favors going backward to an earlier state, often used as a criticism.
summary.zh: “regressionist”指主张或表现出“倒退、回到过去”的人或观点，常带批评意味。

definition.en: a person who supports or promotes regression—returning to an earlier state, style, or set of ideas (often used critically in politics, culture, or social issues).
definition.zh: 倒退主义者；主张社会、思想或制度“回到过去”的人（常带批评意味，常见于政治、文化或社会议题）。

examples.en: Critics called the proposal regressionist because it would weaken protections for workers.
examples.zh: 批评者称这项提议是倒退的，因为它会削弱对工人的保护。

examples.en: Some people see the movement as regressionist, wishing to restore old hierarchies.
examples.zh: 一些人认为这个运动带有倒退主义倾向，想恢复旧有的等级秩序。

definition.en: supporting or showing regression; favoring a return to earlier, less progressive ideas or conditions.
definition.zh: 倒退的；倒退主义的；倾向于回到较早、更不进步的观念或状态的。

examples.en: Many readers found the article’s tone openly regressionist.
examples.zh: 许多读者觉得那篇文章的语气明显倒退。

examples.en: The policy was criticized as regressionist and out of touch with modern realities.
examples.zh: 该政策被批评为倒退，脱离现代现实。

extraExplanation: “regressionist”通常是批评性标签，暗示某人/某政策不仅是“保守”，而是主动推动“倒退、退回旧制度/旧观念”。在正式写作中更常见；日常口语里可能改说“backward / reactionary / going backward”。
词形提示：regress（倒退）→ regression（倒退；回归）→ regressionist（主张倒退的人/倒退主义的）。不要与统计学里的“regression（回归分析）”混淆：统计语境一般不用“regressionist”。

summary.en: Regressions means repeated or multiple “regressions”: either steps backward to an earlier state, returns of symptoms, or (in statistics) regression analyses/models.
summary.zh: regressions 是 regression 的复数：可指多次/多种“倒退”、症状复发，或（统计学中）多种回归分析/回归模型。

definition.en: a return to an earlier or less advanced state, condition, or way of behaving (a “step backward”)
definition.zh: 倒退；退回到较早或较不成熟的状态（“走回头路”）

examples.en: After months of progress, his health showed signs of regression.
examples.zh: 进步了几个月后，他的健康出现了倒退的迹象。

examples.en: Stress can cause a regression to childish behavior.
examples.zh: 压力可能会导致行为退回到更幼稚的状态。

definition.en: (statistics) a method for modeling or predicting the relationship between variables (for example, how one thing changes as another changes)
definition.zh: （统计）回归（分析）：用来建模或预测变量之间关系的方法（例如一个变量随另一个变量如何变化）

examples.en: The researchers used regression to estimate the effect of sleep on test scores.
examples.zh: 研究人员用回归分析来估计睡眠对考试成绩的影响。

examples.en: In linear regression, the model fits a straight line to the data.
examples.zh: 在线性回归中，模型会给数据拟合一条直线。

definition.en: a return of a disease or symptoms after improvement
definition.zh: （病情/症状）复发

examples.en: The doctor warned that stopping the medicine early could lead to a regression.
examples.zh: 医生警告说，过早停药可能会导致复发。

extraExplanation: “Regression”在统计学里非常常见：最基础的是 linear regression（线性回归），用一条直线描述变量关系；更复杂的还有 logistic regression（逻辑回归），常用于做分类预测（例如判断“是/否”）。
注意拼写和动词区分：regress 是动词，表示“倒退/退回”；regression 是名词；regressions 是复数形式，用于表示多次/多种“倒退”或“多种回归模型/结果”。

summary.en: Regressive usually means “moving backward/less advanced,” and in economics it often describes a tax that burdens lower-income people more (regressive tax).
summary.zh: regressive 常指“倒退的/退步的”；在经济学里也常指“累退的”，尤指对低收入者负担更重的税（累退税）。

definition.en: Returning to an earlier or less advanced state; moving backward instead of improving.
definition.zh: 回到较早或较不进步的状态；倒退的、退步的。

examples.en: Many people worry that the new policy is regressive and will harm social progress.
examples.zh: 许多人担心新政策是倒退的，会损害社会进步。

examples.en: Without practice, my speaking skills became regressive over the summer.
examples.zh: 没有练习，我的口语能力在暑假期间退步了。

definition.en: (Of a tax or system) Taking a larger percentage from people with lower incomes than from those with higher incomes.
definition.zh: （指税制或制度）累退的：对低收入者征收的比例更高、负担更重。

examples.en: A sales tax is often criticized as regressive.
examples.zh: 销售税常被批评为累退税。

examples.en: They proposed a more progressive system to replace the regressive one.
examples.zh: 他们提出用更累进的制度来取代这种累退的制度。

extraExplanation: “regressive”常与“progressive（进步的/累进的）”成对出现：社会议题里多指“倒退的”，经济学/税收语境里多指“累退的（regressive tax）”。
词根提示：re-（向后/再）+ gress（走）。同根词有“progress（前进）”“regress（倒退）”。

summary.en: Regressively means “in a backward/less advanced way,” and it’s also common in economics to mean “in a regressive (unfairly heavier on low incomes) way.”
summary.zh: regressively 意为“以倒退的方式”；在经济语境中也常指“以累退的方式（相对更压低收入者）”。

definition.en: In a regressive way; moving backward toward an earlier, less advanced, or less effective state.
definition.zh: 以倒退的方式；向较早、更不进步或较无效的状态回退。

examples.en: Without proper training, the team’s performance improved for a while and then dropped regressively.
examples.zh: 如果没有适当训练，团队的表现可能先好转一阵子，之后又倒退式地下滑。

examples.en: Some reforms were reversed, and the system began to change regressively.
examples.zh: 一些改革被撤回，制度开始以倒退的方式变化。

definition.en: (Economics/Policy) In a way that is regressive—placing a heavier burden on lower-income people than on higher-income people (usually said of taxes or fees).
definition.zh: （经济/政策）以“累退”的方式；让低收入者承担相对更重负担（常形容税或费用）。

examples.en: Sales taxes can affect households regressively because everyone pays the same rate.
examples.zh: 销售税可能具有累退性影响，因为每个人都付同样的税率。

examples.en: The fee hits low-wage workers regressively, taking up a larger share of their income.
examples.zh: 这项费用对低薪劳动者更累退，因为它占他们收入的比例更高。

definition.en: (Technical) Using or relating to statistical regression methods; by means of regression analysis.
definition.zh: （技术用法）使用或涉及统计“回归”方法；通过回归分析。

examples.en: The researchers modeled the data regressively to predict future demand.
examples.zh: 研究人员用回归分析对数据建模，以预测未来需求。

extraExplanation: “regressively”来自形容词 regressive（倒退的/累退的）+ -ly（副词后缀）。日常写作中更常见的是 regressive（adj.），例如 regressive tax（累退税）。
注意区分：regress（v.）=“倒退、退化”；regression（n.）既可指“倒退/退化”，也可指统计学中的“回归”。语境不同，含义差别很大。

summary.en: Regressiveness means the quality of being regressive—either generally “backward/anti-progress,” or, in economics, “taking a bigger share from low incomes,” and sometimes a return toward the average after an extreme result.
summary.zh: Regressiveness 指“倒退性/累退性”：可泛指反进步、走回头路；在经济学中多指税费对低收入者负担比例更高；有时也指极端结果后向平均值回归的倾向。

definition.en: the quality of being regressive (tending to go backward, return to an earlier/less developed state, or oppose progress)
definition.zh: 倒退性；退步倾向（指走回头路、回到较早/较不发展状态，或阻碍进步的特质）

examples.en: Many people criticized the policy for its regressiveness.
examples.zh: 许多人批评这项政策具有倒退性。

examples.en: They worried the reforms would increase regressiveness in the education system.
examples.zh: 他们担心这些改革会加剧教育体系的倒退倾向。

definition.en: (especially in economics) the degree to which a tax or cost takes a larger percentage of income from low-income people than from high-income people
definition.zh: （尤指经济学/税收）累退性（指税费对低收入者占收入比例更高、对高收入者相对更低的程度）

examples.en: The regressiveness of sales tax is often debated.
examples.zh: 消费税的累退性常常引发争论。

examples.en: Critics said the fee’s regressiveness would hurt poor families most.
examples.zh: 批评者说，这项费用的累退性会对贫困家庭伤害最大。

definition.en: (statistics/psychology) a tendency to move back toward an average level after an extreme result (related to “regression to the mean”)
definition.zh: （统计/心理）回归到平均值的倾向（极端结果之后更可能向平均水平靠拢）

examples.en: Apparent improvement may reflect regressiveness rather than real progress.
examples.zh: 看似的改善可能反映的是回归效应，而非真正的进步。

extraExplanation: “regressiveness”常见于公共政策讨论，尤其是税制：如销售税（sales tax）对低收入者更“吃重”，所以常被说成“regressive”。相对的，“progressive tax（累进税）”会让高收入者承担更高比例。
词源上来自拉丁语 regressus（返回、退回），与“regress（后退/回归）”“regressive（倒退的/累退的）”同源。

summary.en: Regressivity means “being regressive”—either socially/politically moving backward, or (in taxation) placing a heavier relative burden on lower-income people.
summary.zh: Regressivity 指“倒退性/累退性”：要么指社会政治上的退步倾向，要么（在税收中）指对低收入者造成更高的相对负担。

definition.en: the quality of being regressive; moving backward to an earlier, less advanced, or less equal state (often used in politics, culture, or social issues)
definition.zh: 倒退性；退步倾向（常用于政治、文化或社会议题中，指回到较早、更不进步或更不平等的状态）

examples.en: Some critics argue that the new policy shows regressivity in its treatment of minority rights.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，新政策在对待少数群体权利方面体现出倒退性。

examples.en: The author warns about cultural regressivity when people reject science and education.
examples.zh: 作者警告说，当人们拒绝科学与教育时，会出现文化上的倒退倾向。

definition.en: in economics and taxation, the quality of taking a larger percentage of income from lower-income people than from higher-income people
definition.zh: （经济学/税收）累退性；对低收入者征收的收入占比高于对高收入者的征收占比

examples.en: Sales taxes are often criticized for their regressivity because they burden low-income households more.
examples.zh: 销售税常因其累退性而受批评，因为它对低收入家庭负担更重。

examples.en: The report measures the regressivity of the fee by comparing payments across income groups.
examples.zh: 该报告通过比较不同收入群体的缴费情况来衡量这项费用的累退性。

examples.en: To reduce regressivity, the government introduced tax credits for working families.
examples.zh: 为降低累退性，政府为工薪家庭推出了税收抵免。

extraExplanation: “regressivity”多见于学术或政策讨论写作，日常口语里更常用“regressive”（形容词）或直接说“a regressive tax / policy（累退税/倒退政策）”。
词根来自拉丁语 regredi（向后走）：re-（向后）+ gradi（走）。因此它既可指“社会/文化倒退”，也可指“税制累退”。
容易与“retrogressive”混淆：两者都可表示“倒退的”，但“regressive/regressivity”在税收语境中更固定、更常见。

summary.en: A regressor is usually a regression model that predicts numbers, or a predictor variable used in a regression.
summary.zh: regressor 通常指用于预测连续数值的回归模型/算法，或回归中的预测变量（自变量）。

definition.en: In statistics and machine learning, a model or algorithm that predicts a continuous (numerical) value (for example, price, temperature, or time) using regression.
definition.zh: 在统计学和机器学习中，指用“回归”方法来预测连续数值（如价格、温度、时间等）的模型或算法。

examples.en: We trained a regressor to predict house prices from location and size.
examples.zh: 我们训练了一个回归模型，用位置和面积来预测房价。

examples.en: A decision-tree regressor can handle non-linear relationships.
examples.zh: 决策树回归器可以处理非线性的关系。

definition.en: In some contexts, a variable (feature) used to explain or predict another variable; also called a predictor or independent variable.
definition.zh: 在一些语境中，指用于解释或预测另一个变量的变量（特征）；也叫预测变量或自变量。

examples.en: Income is a strong regressor of spending in this dataset.
examples.zh: 在这组数据中，收入是消费的一个强预测变量。

examples.en: We included age and education as regressors in the regression equation.
examples.zh: 我们在回归方程中加入了年龄和受教育程度作为自变量。

extraExplanation: “regressor”在机器学习工程里常见于库的命名（如 scikit-learn 的 *RandomForestRegressor*），强调任务是预测连续值（回归），区别于 *classifier*（分类，预测类别）。
在计量经济学里，regressor 很常指“自变量/解释变量”，例如把一组 regressors 放进回归模型中，用来解释因变量（dependent variable）。

summary.en: “Regressors” most often means the predictor variables (independent variables) used in a regression model.
summary.zh: “regressors”最常指回归模型中的预测变量/解释变量（自变量）。

definition.en: (Statistics / machine learning) A variable used to predict or explain another variable in a regression model; a predictor (independent variable).
definition.zh: （统计/机器学习）回归模型中用来预测或解释另一个变量的变量；预测变量（自变量）。

examples.en: In a simple regression, income is the outcome and education is the regressor.
examples.zh: 在简单回归中，收入是结果变量，而教育程度是回归变量（预测变量）。

examples.en: We added age and gender as regressors to control for demographic differences.
examples.zh: 我们把年龄和性别作为回归变量加入模型，以控制人口统计差异。

examples.en: Too many regressors can make the model overfit the data.
examples.zh: 回归变量太多可能导致模型对数据过拟合。

definition.en: A person or thing that regresses (returns to an earlier state or level). (Less common)
definition.zh: 发生“退回/倒退”（回到较早状态或水平）的人或事物。（较少见）

examples.en: Under stress, he became a regressor, returning to old habits.
examples.zh: 在压力下，他出现倒退，又回到了旧习惯。

extraExplanation: 在统计学里，regressor常见于学术写作，基本等同于predictor/explanatory variable（解释变量）。如果模型里有截距项（intercept/constant），有些教材也会把它算作一个regressor。注意：regressor指“变量本身”，而regression指“回归分析/回归方法”。

summary.en: Regret is the sad feeling of wishing you had acted differently, and it can also mean formally saying you are sorry when giving bad news.
summary.zh: Regret 指因“本可以做得不同”而产生的懊悔/遗憾；也可用于正式语境中表达“很遗憾（告知坏消息）”。

definition.en: a feeling of sadness or disappointment about something you did or did not do (often wishing you had acted differently)
definition.zh: （对自己做过或没做的事的）懊悔；遗憾（常带有“要是当初……”的想法）

examples.en: I regret saying those harsh words.
examples.zh: 我后悔说了那些伤人的话。

examples.en: She felt deep regret after missing her father’s last call.
examples.zh: 错过父亲最后一次来电后，她感到深深的遗憾。

definition.en: to feel sorry about something you did or did not do; to wish it had not happened
definition.zh: 后悔；对（某事）感到抱歉/遗憾；希望它没有发生

examples.en: Do you regret your decision?
examples.zh: 你后悔你的决定吗？

examples.en: He regrets not studying harder when he was younger.
examples.zh: 他后悔年轻时没有更努力学习。

definition.en: (formal) to say you are sorry about something, especially when giving bad news
definition.zh: （较正式）对……表示遗憾/抱歉（尤用于告知坏消息时）

examples.en: We regret to inform you that your application was not successful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾地通知您，您的申请未获通过。

examples.en: I regret to say that the train has been canceled.
examples.zh: 很遗憾地说，火车已被取消。

extraExplanation: “regret doing”表示后悔做过某事：I regret telling him the secret.（我后悔告诉他秘密。）
“regret to do”常用于正式场合，表示遗憾要去做某事（多为说出坏消息）：We regret to announce…（我们很遗憾地宣布……）
常见搭配：deep/great regret（深深的遗憾）；express regret（表示遗憾）；no regrets（不后悔/无怨无悔）。

summary.en: Regrettable means “unfortunate; causing regret.”
summary.zh: Regrettable 意为“令人遗憾的；令人后悔的（较正式）”。

definition.en: Causing or deserving regret; unfortunate and disappointing.
definition.zh: 令人遗憾的；可惜的；不幸且令人失望的。

examples.en: It’s regrettable that we missed the deadline.
examples.zh: 很遗憾我们错过了截止日期。

examples.en: The company made a regrettable mistake in its advertisement.
examples.zh: 这家公司在广告中犯了一个令人遗憾的错误。

examples.en: It was a regrettable incident, but no one was hurt.
examples.zh: 那是一件令人遗憾的事件，不过没有人受伤。

extraExplanation: 你输入的拼写是“regretable”，更常见、标准的拼写是“regrettable”（中间通常写双写 t）。在正式写作里建议用“regrettable”。
常见搭配：regrettable mistake（遗憾的错误）、regrettable decision（令人后悔/遗憾的决定）、regrettable incident（遗憾的事件）。语气通常较正式，常用于陈述事实并表达遗憾。

summary.en: Regrettableness means the quality of being regrettable—how unfortunate or worthy of regret something is.
summary.zh: Regrettableness 指“令人遗憾”的性质或程度，即某事有多么不幸或值得惋惜。

definition.en: the quality or state of being regrettable; how much something deserves regret or is unfortunate
definition.zh: 令人遗憾（可惜、惋惜）的性质或程度；某事值得后悔/惋惜的程度

examples.en: The regrettableness of the mistake became clear after the deadline passed.
examples.zh: 截止日期过后，这个错误的令人遗憾之处就变得很明显。

examples.en: We discussed the regrettableness of missing the chance, but we focused on what to do next.
examples.zh: 我们谈到了错失机会的可惜之处，但更关注接下来该怎么做。

extraExplanation: “regrettableness”是由形容词“regrettable（令人遗憾的）”加名词后缀“-ness”构成，意思很直观，但在现代英语里相对少见。
更常用、更自然的表达通常是“regret（遗憾）”“the fact that … is regrettable（……令人遗憾这一事实）”或“it’s a pity/shame（真可惜/真遗憾）”。
在正式写作中如果想强调“程度/性质”，可以用“regrettable nature”或“degree of regret”来替代。

summary.en: Regrettably means “unfortunately” or “with regret.”
summary.zh: Regrettably 表示“遗憾地/不幸地”，带有遗憾或歉意的语气。

definition.en: (Correct spelling: regrettably) Used to say you feel sorry about something, or that something is unfortunate.
definition.zh: （正确拼写：regrettably）用于表示对某事感到遗憾，或说明某事不幸/令人惋惜。

examples.en: Regrettably, we have to cancel the meeting.
examples.zh: 很遗憾，我们不得不取消会议。

examples.en: She was regrettably absent from the ceremony.
examples.zh: 很遗憾，她没能出席典礼。

examples.en: Regrettably, the project ran out of money.
examples.zh: 遗憾的是，这个项目资金用完了。

extraExplanation: “regretably” 是常见拼写错误；标准拼写是 “regrettably”，中间有双写的 t（regret + t + ably）。
语气上，regrettably 比 “unfortunately” 稍更正式、更强调说话者的歉意或遗憾；常用于邮件、公告、新闻写作。

summary.en: Regretful means feeling sorry about something you did or didn’t do, or showing that regret in your tone or expression.
summary.zh: Regretful 指对做过或没做的事感到后悔，也可指语气或表情流露出这种遗憾。

definition.en: Feeling sorry about something you did or did not do; full of regret.
definition.zh: 对自己做过或没做的事感到后悔的；充满懊悔的。

examples.en: I’m regretful about what I said yesterday.
examples.zh: 我对昨天说的话感到后悔。

examples.en: She wrote a regretful email and apologized for the mistake.
examples.zh: 她写了一封充满懊悔的邮件，并为错误道歉。

examples.en: He looked regretful when he realized he had hurt his friend’s feelings.
examples.zh: 当他意识到自己伤害了朋友的感受时，他看起来很懊悔。

definition.en: Expressing regret or apology in tone or style.
definition.zh: （语气或表达方式）表示遗憾或歉意的。

examples.en: His regretful tone made it clear he didn’t mean to offend anyone.
examples.zh: 他带着遗憾的语气，让人清楚他并非有意冒犯。

examples.en: She gave a regretful smile and quietly said goodbye.
examples.zh: 她带着遗憾的微笑，轻声道别。

extraExplanation: “regretful”常用来描述人的感受或神情；而“regrettable”更常用来形容事情本身“令人遗憾”。例如：I’m regretful about my words（我后悔我说的话） vs. It was a regrettable mistake（那是个令人遗憾的错误）。
词根提示：regret（后悔）+ -ful（充满……的），字面意思是“充满后悔的”。
常见搭配：regretful about + 名词/动名词（regretful about leaving early）；look/seem regretful（看起来很后悔）；a regretful tone/smile（遗憾的语气/微笑）。

summary.en: “Regretfully” means “with regret,” often used to express sorrow about the past or to politely deliver bad news.
summary.zh: “regretfully”表示“带着遗憾/歉意地”，可用于对过去感到后悔，也常用于正式通知中礼貌地传达坏消息。

definition.en: In a way that shows you feel sorry about something that happened or that you did; with regret.
definition.zh: 带着遗憾地；懊悔地（表示对发生的事或自己做过的事感到难过或后悔）。

examples.en: I regretfully accepted that I couldn’t change the past.
examples.zh: 我遗憾地接受了自己无法改变过去这个事实。

examples.en: She spoke regretfully about the argument.
examples.zh: 她谈到那次争吵时语气里带着遗憾。

definition.en: Used politely in announcements or messages to say something unfortunate (often a refusal or bad news).
definition.zh: （礼貌用语）很遗憾地（用于通知、声明中表达不幸的消息，常见于拒绝或坏消息）。

examples.en: We regretfully inform you that your application was not successful.
examples.zh: 我们很遗憾地通知您，您的申请未获通过。

examples.en: Regretfully, we have to cancel the event due to the weather.
examples.zh: 很遗憾，由于天气原因我们不得不取消活动。

extraExplanation: “regretfully”常用于较正式或书面语境（邮件、公告、通知）。口语里也常用“Unfortunately,”来表达类似的“很遗憾”，但“regretfully”更强调说话者的歉意或惋惜。

注意区分：
- regretfully（带着遗憾地）强调“说话者/写作者感到遗憾”；
- regrettably（令人遗憾的是）更强调“事情本身很可惜/不幸”。实际使用中两者有时会互换，但正式写作里这个区别更常被提到。

summary.en: Regretfulness is the state or quality of feeling regret or remorse; it can also (less commonly) describe someone or something that shows regret.
summary.zh: Regretfulness 指“懊悔/遗憾的情绪或状态”；也可较少见地作形容词，表示“显得后悔的、表达懊悔的”。

definition.en: a feeling or state of sadness, disappointment, or remorse about something you did or failed to do; the quality of feeling regret
definition.zh: 对自己做过或没做某事感到难过、失望或懊悔的情绪或状态；懊悔之情

examples.en: She spoke with quiet regretfulness about how she treated her friend.
examples.zh: 她谈起自己曾如何对待朋友时，语气里带着淡淡的懊悔。

examples.en: His regretfulness grew after he realized the mistake couldn’t be undone.
examples.zh: 当他意识到错误无法挽回后，他的懊悔之情更强烈了。

definition.en: showing that you feel regret; expressing remorse (less common use)
definition.zh: 显得后悔的；表达懊悔的（较少见用法）

examples.en: He gave a regretfulness look and apologized again.
examples.zh: 他露出一副后悔的表情，又道了一次歉。

extraExplanation: “regretfulness”来自“regret（后悔）+ -ful（充满……的）+ -ness（名词后缀）”。在现代英语里，名词通常更常用“regret”或“remorse”，而“regretfulness”更强调“持续、浓重的后悔情绪”这一“性质/状态”。

近义词辨析：
- regret：最常见，可指轻微到中等的遗憾/后悔（也常用于礼貌表达：I regret to say...）。
- remorse：更强烈，常指对伤害他人或严重过错的“良心谴责”。
- sadness/disappointment：更偏“难过/失望”，不一定包含“我本可以做得不同”的自责。

summary.en: Regretless means having no regret or remorse.
summary.zh: Regretless 意为“无悔的；不感到遗憾或懊悔的”。

definition.en: having no regret; feeling no sorrow or remorse about something
definition.zh: 无悔的；不感到遗憾或懊悔的

examples.en: She left the city regretless, ready to begin a new life.
examples.zh: 她无悔地离开了那座城市，准备开始新生活。

examples.en: He spoke regretless words, even though others were hurt.
examples.zh: 他说话毫无悔意，尽管别人受到了伤害。

examples.en: After years of hard work, he looked back on his choice and felt regretless.
examples.zh: 多年努力之后，他回顾自己的选择，觉得无怨无悔。

extraExplanation: “regretless”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的表达是“with no regrets”或“regret-free”。在文学或较正式的写作中，你可能会看到“regretless”用来营造一种坚定、决绝或冷静的语气。
构词法：regret（遗憾/后悔）+ -less（无……的）。类似结构还有“fearless（无畏的）”“careless（粗心的/不小心的）”。

summary.en: Regretlessness means the state of having no regret—feeling regret-free.
summary.zh: regretlessness 指“无悔、没有后悔的状态”。

definition.en: the state or quality of having no regret; feeling free from regret
definition.zh: 无悔；没有后悔的状态或特质

examples.en: After apologizing and making things right, she felt a calm regretlessness about the past.
examples.zh: 在道歉并把事情补救好之后，她对过去感到一种平静的无悔。

examples.en: He tried to act with regretlessness, but his silence showed he still cared.
examples.zh: 他想表现得毫无悔意，但沉默暴露了他其实还在意。

examples.en: The memoir isn’t about regretlessness; it’s about learning from mistakes.
examples.zh: 这本回忆录不是在讲“无悔”，而是在讲如何从错误中学习。

extraExplanation: “regretlessness”在英语里并不常见，更自然的说法通常是：lack of regret（缺少后悔）、without regret（无怨无悔）、no regrets（不后悔）、regret-free（无悔的）。在正式写作中，用这些替代表达往往更地道。
构词上它来自 regretless（不后悔的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的状态/性质”）。因为“regretless/regretlessness”带一点“刻意强调”的语气，有时可能暗示冷漠或不在乎，语境需要谨慎。

summary.en: “Regrets” means feelings of sadness about past actions or events, or it can be the verb meaning “feels sorry/wishes it were different.”
summary.zh: “regrets”可指“遗憾/后悔（的情绪）”，也可作动词，表示“后悔/感到遗憾”。

definition.en: (plural noun) Feelings of sadness or disappointment about something that happened or something you did (or didn’t do).
definition.zh: （复数名词）对已经发生的事、自己做过或没做的事感到遗憾、后悔的情绪。

examples.en: Her only regrets were the chances she didn’t take.
examples.zh: 她唯一的遗憾是那些她没有把握的机会。

examples.en: I have no regrets about moving to a new city.
examples.zh: 我对搬到新城市没有遗憾。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular) Feels sorry about something; wishes something had been different.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）对某事感到后悔；希望事情当初不同。

examples.en: He regrets saying those harsh words.
examples.zh: 他后悔说了那些刻薄的话。

examples.en: She regrets that she can’t attend the meeting.
examples.zh: 她很遗憾自己不能参加会议。

extraExplanation:
“regret”常见两种句型：
1) regret doing sth（后悔做过某事）：I regret telling him.
2) regret to do sth（遗憾要去做某事，多用于正式场合通知坏消息）：We regret to inform you...
“no regrets”在英语里很常见，表示“无怨无悔/不后悔”，常用于人生选择或励志语境。

summary.en: Regrettable means ‘unfortunate’—something that causes regret.
summary.zh: Regrettable 指“令人遗憾的/不幸的”，让人感到后悔或惋惜。

definition.en: Causing regret; unfortunate or disappointing, and making you wish it had not happened.
definition.zh: 令人遗憾的；不幸的、令人失望的，让人希望它没有发生。

examples.en: It’s regrettable that we didn’t catch the mistake earlier.
examples.zh: 很遗憾我们没有更早发现这个错误。

examples.en: The meeting was canceled at the last minute, which is regrettable for everyone involved.
examples.zh: 会议在最后一刻被取消了，这对所有相关的人来说都很遗憾。

extraExplanation: “Regrettable”比“sad”更正式，常用于新闻、公告、邮件等场合，语气较客观。
常见句型：It’s regrettable that + 从句（“很遗憾……”）；a regrettable mistake/incident（“令人遗憾的错误/事件”）。
易混词：regretful（“后悔的/懊悔的”，描述人的感受）；regrettable（“令人后悔/遗憾的”，描述事情或结果）。

summary.en: “Regrettableness” means the quality of being regrettable—how unfortunate or regret-causing something is.
summary.zh: “regrettableness”指“令人遗憾的性质”，即某事有多不幸或多么引发后悔。

definition.en: The quality of being regrettable; the fact that something makes you feel regret or seems unfortunate.
definition.zh: 令人遗憾的性质；某事引发懊悔或显得不幸的程度。

examples.en: The regrettableness of his decision became clear when the project failed.
examples.zh: 当项目失败时，他这个决定的令人遗憾之处就显现出来了。

examples.en: She spoke about the regrettableness of missing her father’s last phone call.
examples.zh: 她谈到错过父亲最后一通电话这件事有多么令人遗憾。

extraExplanation: “regrettableness”是由形容词 regrettable（令人遗憾的）+ 名词后缀 -ness 构成，意思很直观，但在现代英语中并不常用。更自然、更常见的表达通常是：regret（遗憾/后悔）、the regrettable nature of…（……的遗憾之处）、it’s a pity（真可惜）、it’s unfortunate（很不幸）。
在正式写作中，如果你想表达“某事令人遗憾”，用 regrettable / regrettably 往往更地道；“regrettableness”显得偏生硬或学术化。

summary.en: Regrettably means “unfortunately” or “sadly,” used to express regret about a situation or outcome.
summary.zh: regrettably 表示“遗憾地/不幸的是”，用于表达对某种情况或结果的惋惜与抱歉。

definition.en: In a way that shows you are sorry or disappointed about something; unfortunately.
definition.zh: 以遗憾的方式；令人惋惜地；不幸的是。

examples.en: Regrettably, we have to cancel the meeting because of the storm.
examples.zh: 很遗憾，因为暴风雨我们不得不取消会议。

examples.en: Regrettably, I can’t join you tonight—I have to work late.
examples.zh: 很抱歉/很遗憾，我今晚不能和你一起——我得加班。

examples.en: The package was, regrettably, damaged during shipping.
examples.zh: 包裹在运输过程中不幸受损了。

extraExplanation: “regrettably”常见于较正式的语境（邮件、公告、新闻），用来礼貌地引出坏消息：Regrettably, ...。在更口语的表达里，人们更常说“unfortunately”或“I’m sorry, but ...”。
注意语气差别：regrettably 往往强调说话者对结果感到惋惜；unfortunately 更侧重“倒霉/不走运”的事实本身。

summary.en: “Regretted” is the past form of “regret”: you felt sorry about something and wished it were different.
summary.zh: “regretted”是“regret”的过去式/过去分词：表示对某事感到后悔、遗憾，希望当时能不一样。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of “regret”) to feel sorry about something you did or did not do; to wish it had been different.
definition.zh: （regret 的过去式/过去分词）对做过或没做过的事感到懊悔、遗憾；希望事情当时能不同。

examples.en: She regretted saying those harsh words.
examples.zh: 她后悔说了那些刻薄的话。

examples.en: I regretted not studying harder for the exam.
examples.zh: 我后悔当时没有更努力复习考试。

examples.en: He regretted the decision almost immediately.
examples.zh: 他几乎立刻就后悔了那个决定。

definition.en: Used like an adjective to describe something that you feel sorry about or wish had not happened.
definition.zh: （类似形容词用法）形容让人后悔的、令人遗憾的（事情/决定等）。

examples.en: It was a regretted mistake that cost the team the game.
examples.zh: 那是一个令人遗憾的失误，害球队输掉了比赛。

examples.en: Her regretted comments were reported widely online.
examples.zh: 她那些令自己后悔的言论在网上被广泛传播。

extraExplanation: “regret”很常见的搭配：regret doing sth（后悔做过某事）；regret to do sth（很遗憾要去做某事，常用于正式表达，如：We regret to inform you...）。
“regretted”多用于叙述过去的心理感受（She regretted...）。作为类似形容词的用法较少见，更常说：a regrettable mistake（令人遗憾的错误）或 a mistake I regretted（我后悔的错误）。

summary.en: A “regretter” is a person who often feels regret about past actions or choices.
summary.zh: “regretter”指经常对过去的行为或选择感到后悔的人。

definition.en: a person who feels regret; someone who wishes something in the past had been different
definition.zh: 感到后悔的人；懊悔者（希望过去某事不同的人）

examples.en: As a lifelong regretter, he often replayed old conversations in his head.
examples.zh: 作为一个总爱后悔的人，他经常在脑海里反复回想过去的对话。

examples.en: She’s not a regretter—she learns from mistakes and moves on.
examples.zh: 她不是那种爱后悔的人——她会从错误中学习，然后继续前进。

extraExplanation: “regretter”由动词“regret（后悔）”加上表示“人”的后缀“-er”构成，意思是“会后悔的人”。在日常英语里更常见的表达是“someone who regrets…”或用形容词“regretful（后悔的）”来描述人。

summary.en: “Regretters” means people who feel regret (plural noun).
summary.zh: “regretters”指“感到后悔的人”（复数名词）。

definition.en: people who feel regret; people who wish something they did or didn’t do had been different (plural of “regretter”)
definition.zh: 感到后悔的人；懊悔者（“regretter”的复数）

examples.en: The meeting was full of regretters who wished they had spoken up earlier.
examples.zh: 会议上满是后悔的人，他们希望自己当初能早点发声。

examples.en: Regretters often replay the past instead of focusing on what they can change now.
examples.zh: 后悔的人常常反复回想过去，而不是专注于现在能改变的事。

extraExplanation: “regretter”在现代英语里不算常用名词，更常见的说法是“people who regret (something)”“those who regret it”或用形容词如“regretful people”。
构词上，regret + -er 表示“做某事的人”（类似 worker, learner），再加 -s 变复数：regretters。

summary.en: “Regretting” means feeling sorry about a past action or choice (present participle of “regret”).
summary.zh: “regretting”指对过去的行为或选择感到后悔/遗憾（regret 的现在分词）。

definition.en: the present participle of “regret”: feeling sorry about something you did or did not do, or wishing it had been different
definition.zh: “regret”的现在分词：对自己做过/没做的事感到后悔、遗憾，或希望事情不是这样

examples.en: I’m regretting what I said yesterday.
examples.zh: 我正在后悔昨天说的话。

examples.en: She left early, regretting her decision almost immediately.
examples.zh: 她很早就离开了，几乎立刻就后悔了自己的决定。

examples.en: He sat quietly, regretting not calling his parents sooner.
examples.zh: 他安静地坐着，后悔没有早点给父母打电话。

definition.en: (less common) showing or expressing regret
definition.zh: （较少见）表示遗憾/后悔的；带着歉意的

examples.en: He gave me a regretting look and apologized.
examples.zh: 他带着歉意地看了我一眼并道歉。

examples.en: With a regretting tone, she admitted her mistake.
examples.zh: 她用懊悔的语气承认了错误。

extraExplanation:
“regret”常见两种结构：
1) regret doing sth：后悔做过某事（事情已经发生）。例：I regret saying that.（我后悔说了那句话。）
2) regret to say/tell/inform：很遗憾要说/告知（多用于正式或礼貌表达）。例：We regret to inform you that…（很遗憾通知您……）
“regretting”在口语里常和程度副词搭配：really/seriously/deeply regretting。也常见固定表达：no regrets（不后悔/无怨无悔），常用于鼓励或自我安慰。

summary.en: “Regrettingly” means “with regret; feeling sorry or disappointed,” but “regrettably” is more common in modern English.
summary.zh: “regrettingly”意为“懊悔地／遗憾地”，但现代英语里更常用“regrettably”。

definition.en: In a way that shows you feel sorry or disappointed about something (often a past action or decision).
definition.zh: 以懊悔地／遗憾地方式；表示对某事（常指过去的行为或决定）感到后悔或失望。

examples.en: I regrettingly admitted that I was wrong.
examples.zh: 我很懊悔地承认自己错了。

examples.en: She regrettingly declined the offer because she had to move.
examples.zh: 她很遗憾地拒绝了那个提议，因为她必须搬家。

definition.en: Used to soften bad news in a polite, formal way (similar to “regrettably”).
definition.zh: （较正式）用于委婉表达坏消息；类似 regrettably（遗憾地）。

examples.en: Regrettingly, we can’t accept your application at this time.
examples.zh: 很遗憾，我们目前无法接受你的申请。

examples.en: The flight was regrettingly canceled due to the storm.
examples.zh: 由于暴风雨，航班很遗憾被取消了。

extraExplanation: “regrettingly”在实际英语中不如“regrettably”常见。表达“遗憾地（通知坏消息）”时，母语者更常用 regrettably / unfortunately：Regrettably, we cannot…；表达“带着后悔的心情”时也可以用 with regret / in regret：He spoke with regret.
词形提示：regret（名词/动词）→ regrettable（形容词，令人遗憾的）→ regrettably（副词，遗憾地，常用于正式语境）。

summary.en: Regrew means “grew again” (past tense of regrow).
summary.zh: regrew 表示“又长出来了”，是 regrow 的过去式。

definition.en: past tense of regrow: to grow again after being cut, lost, damaged, or removed
definition.zh: regrow 的过去式：在被切掉、失去、受损或移除后重新长出来

examples.en: After the storm, the grass regrew in a few weeks.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，草在几周内又长出来了。

examples.en: His hair regrew after the treatment ended.
examples.zh: 治疗结束后，他的头发又长回来了。

examples.en: We replanted the trees, but only some regrew successfully.
examples.zh: 我们重新种了树，但只有一部分成功重新长起来。

extraExplanation: regrew 是不规则动词 regrow 的过去式（regrow → regrew → regrown）。常用来描述头发、植物、指甲、组织等“重新长出”。
前缀 re- 表示“再次/重新”（如: rebuild 重建, rewrite 改写）。因此 regrow 字面意思就是“重新生长”。

summary.en: Regrind means to grind something again, and it can also refer to recycled ground material (especially plastics) used again in manufacturing.
summary.zh: regrind 指“再研磨”，也可指制造业中再次粉碎后回用的回磨料（尤其是塑料）。

definition.en: to grind again; to crush or reduce something to smaller pieces one more time (often to improve size or texture)
definition.zh: 再研磨；再次把某物磨碎/磨细（常为改善颗粒大小或质地）

examples.en: If the coffee is too coarse, regrind it for a finer brew.
examples.zh: 如果咖啡粉太粗，就再研磨一次让它更细。

examples.en: The factory regrinds rejected parts into powder for reuse.
examples.zh: 工厂把不合格的零件再研磨成粉末以便再利用。

definition.en: (manufacturing) recycled ground material, especially plastic that has been ground up for reuse
definition.zh: （制造业）回磨料；再生粉碎料（尤指被粉碎后再利用的塑料材料）

examples.en: We mix regrind with new plastic to reduce waste.
examples.zh: 我们把回磨料和新塑料混合，以减少浪费。

examples.en: Too much regrind can weaken the final product.
examples.zh: 回磨料用得太多可能会降低成品强度。

extraExplanation: 在塑料注塑/挤出行业里，regrind 常指把浇口、流道、边角料或不良品粉碎成颗粒后再回用的材料。不同公司对“回磨料占比”的限制不同，因为反复受热/剪切可能影响强度、颜色与稳定性。也常见相关词：regrind ratio（回磨料比例）、regrind hopper（回磨料料斗）。

summary.en: Regrinder means a machine (or sometimes a person/company) that grinds material again for reuse or finer size.
summary.zh: regrinder 指“再研磨机/再粉碎机”，有时也指从事再研磨的个人或公司，用于把材料重新研磨以便再利用或变得更细。

definition.en: a machine or device that grinds something again, often to remake it into smaller pieces or a reusable form
definition.zh: 再研磨机；再粉碎机（把材料再次研磨/粉碎成更小颗粒或可再利用形态的机器）

examples.en: The plastic regrinder turns scrap parts into pellets for reuse.
examples.zh: 塑料再研磨机把边角料粉碎成颗粒，方便再次利用。

examples.en: We installed a regrinder to reduce waste in the factory.
examples.zh: 我们安装了再研磨机来减少工厂里的浪费。

definition.en: a person or company that regrinds materials (such as metal, plastic, or coffee)
definition.zh: 再研磨者；从事再研磨业务的个人或公司（如金属、塑料或咖啡等）

examples.en: The regrinder buys leftover plastic and processes it for manufacturers.
examples.zh: 这家再研磨商收购剩余塑料并加工后卖给制造商。

examples.en: Ask a local regrinder if they can handle this type of scrap.
examples.zh: 问问当地的再研磨商能不能处理这种废料。

extraExplanation: “Regrinder”常见于制造业与回收再利用语境，尤其是塑料行业（把浇口料、次品等“scrap/regrind”再次粉碎成可回用的颗粒）。
构词法：re-（再、重新）+ grinder（研磨机/研磨者）。有时也会看到相关名词“regrind”（再研磨后的料/再研磨过程）。

summary.en: Regrinding means grinding something again, often for refinement or reuse.
summary.zh: Regrinding 指对材料再次研磨/打磨，常用于使其更细、修复表面或回收再利用。

definition.en: the process of grinding something again (often to make it finer, smoother, or usable again)
definition.zh: 再次研磨/重新打磨的过程（常为使材料更细、更光滑或可再次使用）

examples.en: The regrinding of the coffee beans made the powder much finer.
examples.zh: 把咖啡豆重新研磨后，粉末变得更细了。

examples.en: In the factory, plastic scraps are collected for regrinding and reuse.
examples.zh: 在工厂里，塑料边角料会被收集起来重新研磨并再利用。

definition.en: grinding something again (present participle/gerund of “regrind”)
definition.zh: 重新研磨；再次打磨（“regrind”的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: They are regrinding the surface to remove scratches.
examples.zh: 他们正在重新打磨表面以去除划痕。

examples.en: Regrinding the spices right before cooking improves the flavor.
examples.zh: 烹饪前现重新研磨香料能提升味道。

extraExplanation: 在制造业语境里，regrinding 常指把“边角料/废料（scrap）”再次粉碎或研磨成颗粒，以便回收再利用（如塑料、橡胶、金属粉末）。在刀具加工中也可能指“重新磨刃/重磨（regrind a blade/tool）”，让刀口恢复锋利或修正尺寸。

summary.en: “Regrinds” can mean (1) grinds again, or (2) recycled, re-ground material used in manufacturing (especially plastics).
summary.zh: “regrinds”可指（1）再次研磨/重新粉碎，（2）制造业中再次粉碎并回用的再生材料（尤指塑料回磨料）。

definition.en: to grind something again (often to make it finer or to process it a second time)
definition.zh: 再次研磨；重新粉碎（常指让材料更细或进行二次加工）

examples.en: The lab regrinds the sample to get a more even powder.
examples.zh: 实验室会把样品再研磨一次，以得到更均匀的粉末。

examples.en: If the coffee tastes weak, the grinder regrinds the beans more finely.
examples.zh: 如果咖啡味道淡，研磨机会把咖啡豆重新磨得更细。

definition.en: (manufacturing, especially plastics) pieces of material that have been ground up again and reused as raw material
definition.zh: （制造业，尤指塑料）回磨料；再生粉碎料（将废料粉碎后再次作为原料使用）

examples.en: The factory mixes regrinds with virgin plastic to reduce waste.
examples.zh: 工厂把回磨料与原生塑料混合使用，以减少浪费。

examples.en: Too many regrinds can change the color and strength of the product.
examples.zh: 回磨料比例过高可能会改变产品的颜色和强度。

extraExplanation: “regrinds”常见于塑料注塑/挤出行业：指边角料、次品等被粉碎（grind）后回到料斗再次加工的材料。中文也常说“回料/粉碎料/回磨料”。不同工厂会规定可添加的比例（例如10%或更低），以控制性能与外观一致性。

summary.en: Regrip means to hold something again—often changing or tightening your hold, especially in sports.
summary.zh: Regrip 指重新握住某物，常表示换一种或更紧的握法；在体育运动中尤为常见。

definition.en: to grip something again, often with a different or firmer hold
definition.zh: 重新握住（某物）；再抓紧一次（通常换一种或更稳的握法）

examples.en: He regripped the rope to get better control before climbing higher.
examples.zh: 他重新握紧绳子，以便在继续往上爬前更好地控制。

examples.en: If your hands are sweaty, regrip the tool and slow down.
examples.zh: 如果你手出汗了，就重新握好工具并放慢速度。

definition.en: (sports, especially tennis/golf/baseball) to change how you hold the handle or bat to adjust technique
definition.zh: （体育，尤指网球/高尔夫/棒球）改变握拍/握杆/握棒方式，以调整动作或技术

examples.en: She regripped the racket for a backhand slice.
examples.zh: 她为打反手削球改变了握拍方式。

examples.en: Golf coaches often ask beginners to regrip the club before fixing their swing.
examples.zh: 高尔夫教练常常先让初学者重新调整握杆方式，再去纠正挥杆。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。“regrip”在日常语境里就是“再握一次”，但在球拍、球杆、球棒等运动中很常见，常暗示为了某种打法（如反手、切削、加强旋转）而“换握法”。
在运动指导中，regrip 往往是很具体的技术动作：比如把手转到更偏东方式/大陆式握法等（具体名称因运动而异）。

summary.en: “Regripped” means “gripped again” or “refitted with a new grip,” especially for better control.
summary.zh: “regripped”表示“重新握住/再次抓紧”，也可指器材“重新装（包）握把”，多为更好控制与手感。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of regrip) to grip something again, often to get better control or a more comfortable hold.
definition.zh: （regrip 的过去式/过去分词）再次握住、重新抓紧某物，通常是为了更稳、更舒服或更好控制。

examples.en: She regripped the handle before lifting the heavy box.
examples.zh: 她在抬起那个重箱子前重新握紧了把手。

examples.en: He regripped his tennis racket after the serve.
examples.zh: 他发球后重新握住了网球拍。

examples.en: The climber regripped the rock and found a safer hold.
examples.zh: 攀岩者重新抓住岩石，找到了更安全的支点。

definition.en: Describing something that has been gripped again or fitted with a new grip (common in sports or tools).
definition.zh: 形容“重新握过/重新装上握把（握套）”的（常见于运动器材或工具）。

examples.en: He used a regripped golf club for better comfort.
examples.zh: 他用了一支重新装握把的高尔夫球杆，让手感更舒服。

examples.en: The regripped screwdriver felt less slippery.
examples.zh: 这把重新装握把的螺丝刀不那么滑手了。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”（如 redo 重新做、rebuild 重建）。因此 regrip 直观理解就是“再握一次/重新握紧”。
在运动语境中，regrip 既可指“重新调整手的握法”，也可指“更换/重新包裹器材的握把”（例如球拍、球杆、把手）。

summary.en: “Regroom” means to groom again—to tidy or brush someone’s or an animal’s appearance a second time.
summary.zh: “regroom”指“再次打理/梳理”，把人或动物的外表重新整理一遍。

definition.en: to groom again; to tidy, brush, or care for someone’s (or an animal’s) appearance a second time, often to fix messiness after activity
definition.zh: 再次梳理/整理；再度打理（人或动物）的外表，常指活动后又弄乱了需要重新整理

examples.en: After the dog rolled in the grass, I had to regroom her coat.
examples.zh: 狗在草地里打滚后，我只好再把她的毛梳理一遍。

examples.en: He quickly regroomed his hair before the video call.
examples.zh: 视频会议前，他迅速把头发重新整理了一下。

extraExplanation: “regroom”由前缀 re-（再次）+ groom（梳理、打理）构成，属于比较直观的合成用法。更常见、更自然的表达也可以用 “groom again” 或 “touch up (one’s hair/makeup)”（补妆/稍作整理）。
在宠物美容、赛马或马术语境里更常见：groom 指给动物梳毛、清洁、护理；regroom 就是又做一遍以保持整洁。

summary.en: “Regrooms” usually means “re-grooms”: to groom again (tidy hair/fur or appearance again).
summary.zh: “regrooms”通常理解为“re-grooms”：再次梳理/整理（头发、毛发或外观）。

definition.en: to groom again; to tidy, brush, or style (someone or something) a second time
definition.zh: 再次梳理／整理（人或动物的毛发、外观等）；重新修饰

examples.en: After the rain, she regroomed her hair before the meeting.
examples.zh: 淋雨之后，她在开会前又重新整理了一下头发。

examples.en: The dog rolled in the grass, so we had to regroom him.
examples.zh: 狗在草地里打滚，所以我们得再给它梳洗一遍。

definition.en: (rare) to train or prepare again for a role or purpose
definition.zh: （较少见）重新训练；再次培养以适应某个角色或用途

examples.en: The company regroomed experienced staff for leadership positions.
examples.zh: 公司重新培养有经验的员工，来担任领导岗位。

extraExplanation: “regrooms”本身不太常见，多数情况下更常写作 re-grooms（re- + groom 的第三人称单数），意思是“再次整理/梳理”。
如果你原本想找的是 “restrooms（洗手间）”，那很可能是拼写输入错误：restrooms /ˈrɛstˌrumz/。你也可以告诉我你看到这个词的句子，我可以帮你判断具体意思。

summary.en: Regroove means to cut grooves again—most often into tires—and sometimes means getting back into a rhythm or routine.
summary.zh: Regroove 指再次刻出沟槽（最常指轮胎重新刻沟）；也可非正式地指重新回到节奏或习惯。

definition.en: to cut new grooves into something again, especially a tire, to improve grip or extend its usable life
definition.zh: 再次在某物上切出沟槽（尤其指给轮胎重新刻沟），以增加抓地力或延长使用寿命

examples.en: The mechanic regrooved the truck’s tires to improve traction on wet roads.
examples.zh: 技师把卡车轮胎重新刻沟，以提升在湿路上的抓地力。

examples.en: Some fleets regroove tires to reduce costs, where it is legal and safe.
examples.zh: 在合法且安全的情况下，一些车队会给轮胎重新刻沟以降低成本。

definition.en: to make the grooves on a record, disc, or similar surface again (or more clearly) so it can work better
definition.zh: 重新刻出（或加深）唱片、圆盘等表面的沟槽，使其更好地工作

examples.en: Old discs can’t usually be regrooved at home without specialized tools.
examples.zh: 旧光盘/圆盘通常无法在家里重新刻沟，需要专用工具。

examples.en: The machine was designed to regroove worn surfaces precisely.
examples.zh: 这台机器的设计目的就是精确地重新刻出磨损表面的沟槽。

definition.en: (informal) to get back into a familiar routine or rhythm again
definition.zh: （非正式）重新回到熟悉的节奏/状态；重新进入“状态”

examples.en: After the holiday break, it took me a few days to regroove my study routine.
examples.zh: 假期结束后，我花了几天才把学习节奏重新找回来。

examples.en: The team regrooved quickly after a rough first quarter.
examples.zh: 球队在第一节不顺之后很快找回了节奏。

synonyms: get back into the groove (related idiom)
extraExplanation: “Regroove”最常见于轮胎行业：在轮胎胎面上“重新刻沟”以加深花纹，从而提升排水与抓地力、延长里程。但并非所有轮胎都允许这样做；是否可刻沟通常取决于轮胎类型（如标注可刻沟的轮胎）、当地法规与安全标准。
日常口语里把“groove”引申为“节奏/习惯”，所以 regroove 也可指“重新进入状态”。

summary.en: “Regrooved” means grooves were cut again into something, or describes something that has been re-grooved.
summary.zh: “regrooved”指把沟槽再次切出来，或形容“被重新开槽”的状态。

definition.en: cut grooves into something again (often to restore grip, shape, or function).
definition.zh: 再次在某物上切出沟槽（常为恢复抓地力、形状或功能）。

examples.en: The shop regrooved the worn tires to improve traction on wet roads.
examples.zh: 修理店把磨损的轮胎重新开槽，以提升湿路抓地力。

examples.en: After years of use, the metal roller was regrooved to match the original pattern.
