examples.zh: 使用多年后，这个金属滚轮被重新开槽，以符合原来的纹路。

definition.en: having grooves cut into it again; re-cut with grooves.
definition.zh: 被再次开槽的；重新切出沟槽的。

examples.en: The regrooved tire looked deeper and more defined than before.
examples.zh: 重新开槽后的轮胎沟纹看起来比之前更深、更清晰。

examples.en: We tested a regrooved tread pattern for better performance in mud.
examples.zh: 我们测试了一种重新开槽的胎面花纹，以提高泥地表现。

extraExplanation: “regroove”常见于轮胎行业：对特定类型的商用轮胎（如卡车轮胎）在规定条件下进行“重新开槽”，以延长使用寿命或改善抓地力。但并非所有轮胎都允许这样做，实际使用需遵循当地法规与安全标准。
在制造与维修语境中也可用于零件加工：例如滚轮、模具、皮带轮等表面纹路磨损后，通过再次切槽恢复原有纹理或排屑/导流功能。

summary.en: “Regrooves” means cuts grooves again—often in machining, tire tread work, or record-making.
summary.zh: “Regrooves”指“重新开槽/重新刻纹”，常用于机械加工、轮胎胎纹处理或唱片制版等语境。

definition.en: to cut grooves into something again; to make the grooves new or deeper
definition.zh: 再次在某物上刻出沟槽；把沟槽重新加工得更清晰或更深

examples.en: The workshop regrooves worn parts to help them fit better.
examples.zh: 这家工坊会把磨损的零件重新开槽，以便更贴合。

examples.en: This tool regrooves the surface so it grips better.
examples.zh: 这个工具会把表面重新开槽，让它更防滑。

definition.en: (of a tire shop or machine) to cut new tread grooves into a used tire to improve traction
definition.zh: （指轮胎店或机器）在旧轮胎上重新切割胎纹沟槽，以提升抓地力

examples.en: The company regrooves truck tires to extend their service life.
examples.zh: 这家公司会给卡车轮胎重新刻纹，以延长使用寿命。

examples.en: Some fleets regroove tires, but it must follow safety rules.
examples.zh: 有些车队会给轮胎重新刻纹，但必须遵守安全规范。

definition.en: (audio/record-making) to cut grooves again when making or repairing a record master
definition.zh: （音频/制版）在制作或修复唱片母盘时重新刻录沟槽

examples.en: The engineer regrooves the master to correct a problem in the cut.
examples.zh: 工程师重新刻母盘的沟槽，以修正刻片中的问题。

extraExplanation: “regrooves”通常是动词第三人称单数（he/she/it regrooves），来自 re-（再、重新）+ groove（沟槽、刻纹）。
在日常英语里它不算常见，更常出现在技术语境：机械加工（重新开槽）、轮胎行业（给轮胎重新刻纹以增加抓地力并延长寿命）、以及黑胶唱片制版（重新刻沟）。

summary.en: Regrooving means cutting new grooves into a worn surface—most often a tire tread—to improve traction or extend its life.
summary.zh: Regrooving 指在磨损表面（多为轮胎胎面）重新切出沟槽，以增强抓地力或延长寿命。

definition.en: the process of cutting new grooves into a worn surface (especially a tire tread) to improve grip or extend usable life
definition.zh: 在磨损表面上重新切出沟槽的过程（尤指给轮胎胎面再开槽），以提升抓地力或延长使用寿命

examples.en: The fleet uses regrooving to extend the life of truck tires.
examples.zh: 这家公司车队用轮胎再开槽来延长卡车轮胎的使用寿命。

examples.en: Regrooving can improve traction on wet roads when done correctly.
examples.zh: 如果操作得当，再开槽可以提升湿路抓地力。

definition.en: cutting new grooves into something again; making the grooves deeper or clearer (present participle of “regroove”)
definition.zh: 再次开槽；把沟槽重新切深或切清楚（动词 regroove 的现在分词）

examples.en: The technician is regrooving the tires before the long haul.
examples.zh: 技师正在给轮胎再开槽，以便跑长途。

examples.en: They are regrooving the pattern to match the original design.
examples.zh: 他们正在重新开槽，使花纹接近原来的设计。

extraExplanation: “Regrooving”最常见于商用车辆轮胎领域：用专用刀具在允许的胎面上再切出沟槽。并非所有轮胎都适合再开槽，通常需要轮胎标注为可再开槽（如“REGROOVABLE”）或符合当地标准。
安全与合规很重要：再开槽过深可能伤到胎体结构，增加爆胎风险；不同国家/地区对再开槽轮胎在公路上的使用也可能有规定。若用于日常乘用车，需格外谨慎并遵循专业建议。

summary.en: Reground means either “ground again (regrind)” or “connected to electrical ground again (re-ground).”
summary.zh: reground 可指“再研磨（重新磨碎）”，也可指“（电气）重新接地”。

definition.en: to grind again; to crush or mill something a second time to make it finer or to reprocess it
definition.zh: 再研磨；把某物再次磨碎/碾磨，以变得更细或重新加工

examples.en: The coffee tasted weak, so he reground the beans and brewed a stronger cup.
examples.zh: 咖啡味道太淡了，所以他把豆子再研磨一次，煮出更浓的一杯。

examples.en: The lab reground the dried sample into a fine powder for testing.
examples.zh: 实验室把干燥样品重新研磨成细粉以便检测。

definition.en: to connect again to ground (earth) in an electrical system; to restore a grounding connection for safety or stability
definition.zh: （电气）重新接地；为安全或稳定重新恢复接地连接

examples.en: After replacing the outlet, the electrician regrounded the circuit to prevent shocks.
examples.zh: 更换插座后，电工把电路重新接地以防触电。

examples.en: If you hear buzzing, you may need to reground the audio equipment.
examples.zh: 如果听到嗡嗡声，可能需要把音频设备重新接地。

extraExplanation:
“reground”常见于技术或操作说明里：
1）加工/材料领域：表示“再研磨”，例如咖啡豆、颜料、矿粉、样品等；
2）电工/电子领域：表示“重新接地”，与安全、防干扰（降噪）有关。
写作中也常见连字符形式“re-ground”（过去分词/形容用法），如：re-ground coffee（再研磨的咖啡粉）。

summary.en: Regroup means to form a group again, or to reorganize into new groups after a break, problem, or change.
summary.zh: Regroup 指重新集合/重整旗鼓，或把人和事物重新分组、重新组织。

definition.en: to come together again as a group, often after being separated or confused, in order to continue or make a new plan
definition.zh: （人）重新集合、重新组织起来（常指分散或混乱后）以继续行动或制定新计划

examples.en: After the surprise attack, the soldiers regrouped behind the hill.
examples.zh: 遭到突袭后，士兵们在山后重新集结。

examples.en: Let’s take a five-minute break and then regroup to decide what to do next.
examples.zh: 我们休息五分钟，然后再重新集合，决定下一步怎么做。

examples.en: The team regrouped after losing the first match.
examples.zh: 球队在输掉第一场比赛后重新振作、重新组织。

definition.en: to organize people, ideas, or things into new groups or categories
definition.zh: 将（人、想法或事物）重新分组、重新归类

examples.en: We regrouped the students by skill level for the next activity.
examples.zh: 我们按能力水平把学生重新分组进行下一项活动。

examples.en: The company regrouped its products into three main categories.
examples.zh: 公司把产品重新归为三大类。

extraExplanation: “regroup”由前缀 re-（再次）+ group（分组/群体）构成，核心含义是“重新形成一个可行动的整体”。在新闻、军事、体育和工作会议中很常见，常带有“调整策略、恢复秩序、再出发”的语气。
常见搭配：regroup and try again（重整旗鼓再试）、regroup after ...（在……之后重新集合/调整）、regroup your thoughts（整理思路）。

summary.en: “Regrouped” means came together again and reorganized (past form of “regroup”), or describes something that has been reorganized.
summary.zh: “regrouped”表示“重新集合并重新组织”（regroup 的过去式/过去分词），也可作形容词指“已重新组织/集结的”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of) to come together again in a group, often to reorganize or make a new plan after a setback or change.
definition.zh: （regroup 的过去式/过去分词）重新集合、重新组织（常指在受挫、变化后调整队形或计划）。

examples.en: After the first try failed, the team regrouped and changed their strategy.
examples.zh: 第一次尝试失败后，团队重新集合并调整了策略。

examples.en: We got separated in the crowd, but we regrouped at the main entrance.
examples.zh: 我们在人群中走散了，但在主入口重新集合了。

examples.en: The hikers regrouped before continuing up the mountain.
examples.zh: 徒步者在继续上山前重新集合。

definition.en: Reorganized or brought back together into a group.
definition.zh: 被重新组织的；重新集合起来的。

examples.en: The regrouped volunteers worked more efficiently than before.
examples.zh: 重新组织后的志愿者比之前更高效。

examples.en: The regrouped unit moved out at dawn.
examples.zh: 重新集结的队伍在黎明出发。

extraExplanation: “regroup”常见于军事与商业语境：军事上指部队撤回后“重新集结、整队”；商业/项目中则指在遇到问题后“重新梳理人员分工与计划”。
拼写提示：regroup + -ed → regrouped（不双写 p）。美式英语里既可用于正式写作，也常用于口语（We’ll regroup and try again）。

summary.en: Regrouping means reorganizing into new groups or, in math, using borrowing/carrying to rearrange numbers.
summary.zh: Regrouping 指重新分组/重整；在数学中指借位或进位来重新组合数字。

definition.en: the act of forming again into a group; reorganizing people or things into new groups or positions
definition.zh: 重新组成团队或群体；把人或物重新分组、重新部署的行为

examples.en: After the first round, the coach called for regrouping before the next game.
examples.zh: 第一回合后，教练要求在下一场比赛前重新集合、重新调整。

examples.en: The company’s regrouping created two new departments.
examples.zh: 公司的重组成立了两个新部门。

definition.en: (in math) the process of rearranging numbers in addition or subtraction by borrowing or carrying to make calculation easier
definition.zh: （数学）通过“借位”或“进位”来重新组合数字，使加减计算更容易的过程（常译为“重新分组”）

examples.en: In 47 + 18, you use regrouping to carry 1 to the tens place.
examples.zh: 在 47 + 18 中，你用重新分组把 1 进到十位。

examples.en: She struggles with subtraction regrouping when there’s a zero in the middle.
examples.zh: 当中间有 0 时，她做减法的借位（重新分组）比较吃力。

extraExplanation: “regrouping”既可以用于日常语境（团队重新集合/重整），也常用于小学数学里指“借位/进位”的步骤。日常中它偏向“重新整队、调整策略”；数学里更强调把个位、十位等“重新组合”。
词形上来自动词“regroup”（重新集合/重组）+ “-ing”，可表示动作过程或结果。常见搭配：regrouping after a loss（失利后重整）、regrouping the team（重组团队）、regrouping in subtraction/addition（加减法中的借位/进位）。

summary.en: Regroupment means reorganizing or gathering again into a new group, often to recover or plan next steps.
summary.zh: Regroupment 指重新集结或重组为新的团队/编制，常用于调整、恢复或规划下一步。

definition.en: A reorganization of people, forces, or resources into a new group or formation, often after a setback or to improve efficiency.
definition.zh: （人员、部队或资源的）重新集结；重组（常为在受挫后或为提高效率而进行）。

examples.en: After the unexpected loss, the campaign team called for a regroupment and revised its strategy.
examples.zh: 在意外失利之后，竞选团队决定重新集结，并调整策略。

examples.en: The troops began a regroupment behind the ridge before continuing the advance.
examples.zh: 部队在山脊后方重新集结，然后继续推进。

definition.en: A new group formed from smaller groups, or the act of forming such a group.
definition.zh: 由多个小组重新组成的新团体；或重新组成团体的行为。

examples.en: The regroupment of departments created a single customer-service center.
examples.zh: 各部门的重组建立了一个统一的客户服务中心。

examples.en: Several local clubs joined in a regroupment to share funding and space.
examples.zh: 几个本地社团重新组合在一起，共享资金和场地。

extraExplanation: “Regroupment”在英式与法式英语语境里较常见，尤见于军事与政治报道；在美式日常表达中，人们更常说“regrouping”或“reorganization”。
词根提示：re-（再次）+ group（成组）+ -ment（名词后缀，表示行为/结果）。理解这一结构有助于记忆同类词，如“development”“agreement”。

summary.en: “Regroups” means comes together again as a group, or reorganizes a group or plan.
summary.zh: “regroups”表示（队伍/人群）重新集合，或对团队/计划进行重新组织与调整。

definition.en: (intransitive) to come together again as a group after being separated, scattered, or defeated
definition.zh: （不及物）在分散、走散或受挫后重新集合、重整队伍

examples.en: After the meeting, the students regrouped outside the classroom.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，学生们在教室外重新集合。

examples.en: The team fell behind early but regrouped at halftime.
examples.zh: 球队开局落后，但在中场休息时重新调整并振作起来。

definition.en: (transitive) to reorganize a group, plan, or resources in a new way
definition.zh: （及物）重新组织（团队/计划/资源），重新部署

examples.en: The manager regrouped the staff to focus on customer support.
examples.zh: 经理重新分配员工，把重点放在客户支持上。

examples.en: We need to regroup our efforts and finish the project this week.
examples.zh: 我们需要重新整合力量，在这周完成项目。

extraExplanation: “regroup(s)”是动词“regroup”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it regroups）。过去式和过去分词是“regrouped”。
这个词常见于军事、体育和职场语境，强调“先停一下—重新集合/调整—再继续行动”的感觉。

summary.en: Regrow means to grow again, or to make something grow again after it was lost or cut.
summary.zh: regrow 表示（某物）重新长出来，或使某物在失去/被剪掉后再次生长。

definition.en: To grow again after being cut, damaged, or lost (for example, hair, grass, or a plant).
definition.zh: （在被剪掉、受损或失去后）重新长出来（如头发、草或植物）。

examples.en: My hair is starting to regrow after the haircut.
examples.zh: 剪完头发后，我的头发开始重新长出来了。

examples.en: If you keep watering it, the plant may regrow.
examples.zh: 如果你持续浇水，这株植物可能会重新长出来。

examples.en: The lawn regrows quickly in spring.
examples.zh: 春天草坪长得很快，会很快重新长出来。

definition.en: To cause something to grow again; to regrow something (often used in science, farming, or medicine).
definition.zh: 使某物重新生长；让……再长出来（常用于科学、农业或医学语境）。

examples.en: Some animals can regrow lost limbs.
examples.zh: 一些动物可以让失去的肢体重新长出来。

examples.en: The goal is to regrow healthy tissue after injury.
examples.zh: 目标是在受伤后让健康组织重新生长。

extraExplanation: “regrow”= re-（再次）+ grow（生长），意思直观：再次生长。
日常中常谈头发、草坪、植物；更正式/专业的语境常见于再生医学（regrow tissue）或生物学（regrow limbs）。
口语里也常用“grow back”表达同样意思：Hair grows back. = Hair regrows.

summary.en: “Regrowing” means growing again or growing back after being removed or damaged.
summary.zh: “regrowing”表示（被剪掉或受损后）正在重新生长、长回来的。

definition.en: growing again after being cut, damaged, or removed; returning to growth.
definition.zh: （被剪掉、受损或移除后）重新生长的；再度长出来的。

examples.en: The vet said the fur is regrowing after the treatment.
examples.zh: 兽医说治疗后毛发正在重新长出来。

examples.en: New leaves are regrowing on the tree after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，树上又重新长出新叶了。

definition.en: the process of growing again; the act of starting to grow back.
definition.zh: 重新生长的过程；再度长回来的行为。

examples.en: Regrowing takes time, so be patient with your hair.
examples.zh: 头发重新长回来需要时间，所以要有耐心。

examples.en: Good sleep and nutrition can support regrowing after illness.
examples.zh: 良好的睡眠和营养能帮助病后恢复与重新生长。

definition.en: present participle of “regrow”: to grow again (often used in continuous tenses).
definition.zh: “regrow”的现在分词：正在再次生长（常用于进行时）。

examples.en: The grass is regrowing where we reseeded the lawn.
examples.zh: 我们重新播种的地方，草正在再度长起来。

examples.en: My eyebrows are regrowing slowly.
examples.zh: 我的眉毛正在慢慢长回来。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再、重新”，加在“grow（生长）”前构成“regrow（再生长）”。“regrowing”常用来描述头发、草、植物、牙齿/角质等“长回来”的状态。日常里也常见“grow back（长回来）”，语气更口语。

summary.en: Regrown means “grown again,” and it’s also the past participle of regrow.
summary.zh: regrown 表示“重新长出的；再生的”，也是 regrow 的过去分词。

definition.en: grown again after being cut, removed, damaged, or lost; returned to its previous size or state through new growth
definition.zh: （被剪掉、移除、受损或失去后）重新长出来的；再生并恢复到原来状态的

examples.en: After a few months, her hair had regrown enough to style again.
examples.zh: 几个月后，她的头发已经重新长到可以再次做造型了。

examples.en: The regrown grass covered the bare patches in the yard.
examples.zh: 重新长出的草覆盖了院子里原本裸露的地方。

definition.en: past participle of “regrow”: to grow again
definition.zh: “regrow”的过去分词：再生；重新生长

examples.en: The forest has regrown since the fire.
examples.zh: 自从那场火灾之后，森林已经重新长起来了。

examples.en: Some plants regrown quickly after being cut back.
examples.zh: 有些植物修剪后会很快重新长出来。

extraExplanation: “regrown”常见于描述头发、草地、森林、指甲等“自然生长的东西”在受损或被去除后又长回来的结果状态。口语里也常直接用动词“regrow”（例如：My hair is regrowing.）。
拼写上既可写作 regrown（更常见），也会在某些写作风格中见到 re-grown（强调“再次”的感觉，但相对少见）。

summary.en: “Regrows” means “grows again,” especially after something was cut, damaged, or lost.
summary.zh: “regrows”表示“重新长出来/再生”，常指被剪掉、受损或失去后又长回来。

definition.en: to grow again after being cut, damaged, or lost (often used for hair, plants, or body parts in animals)
definition.zh: （被剪掉、受损或失去后）重新长出来；再生（常用于头发、植物或某些动物的身体部位）

examples.en: After the fire, grass slowly regrows on the hills.
examples.zh: 火灾过后，山坡上的草慢慢重新长出来。

examples.en: My hair regrows quickly after a haircut.
examples.zh: 我剪完头发后，头发长得很快。

definition.en: to cause something to grow again; to restore by growing (less common, more formal)
definition.zh: 使……重新生长；通过生长来恢复（较少见，较正式）

examples.en: Some gardeners try to regrow vegetables from kitchen scraps.
examples.zh: 一些园艺爱好者会用厨房剩菜来重新种出蔬菜。

examples.en: Scientists hope to regrow damaged tissue in the future.
examples.zh: 科学家希望未来能让受损组织再生。

extraExplanation: “regrows”是动词“regrow”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it regrows）。
词形变化常见：regrow – regrew – regrown。前缀“re-”表示“再次/重新”。

summary.en: Regrowth means the process of growing again after loss or damage, especially in hair, plants, or forests.
summary.zh: Regrowth 指在失去或受损之后再次生长的过程，尤常用于头发、植物或森林。

definition.en: the process of growing again after being cut, damaged, or lost (often used for hair, plants, or forests)
definition.zh: （被剪掉、受损或失去后）再次生长、再生的过程（常用于头发、植物或森林）

examples.en: This shampoo is designed to support hair regrowth after thinning.
examples.zh: 这款洗发水旨在帮助头发变稀后促进再生。

examples.en: After the wildfire, the park focused on forest regrowth.
examples.zh: 野火之后，公园的重点是森林的恢复再生。

examples.en: Regular pruning can encourage healthier regrowth in many plants.
examples.zh: 定期修剪能促进许多植物更健康地再生。

extraExplanation: “regrowth”由前缀 re-（再次）+ growth（生长）构成，常见于医学/美容语境（hair regrowth 头发再生）、生态与环境语境（forest regrowth 森林再生/恢复）。
近义表达会因语境而变：强调“恢复”可用 recovery；强调“重新长出”可用 regrowth/resprouting（植物重新抽芽）；强调“再造、重建”有时会用 regeneration（更偏正式/学术）。

summary.en: “Regrowths” means new growths that grow back after something was cut, damaged, or lost.
summary.zh: “Regrowths”指在被砍、受损或失去之后再次长出来的新的生长物（再生长）。

definition.en: new growth again after being cut, damaged, or removed (plural of “regrowth”)
definition.zh: （regrowth 的复数）在被砍伐、损坏或移除后再次长出的新生长物；再生

examples.en: After the wildfire, the regrowths of small trees appeared within a few months.
examples.zh: 野火过后，几个月内就出现了小树的再生长。

examples.en: The gardener trimmed the hedge and later checked for healthy regrowths.
examples.zh: 园丁修剪了树篱，后来检查是否有健康的新芽再长出来。

definition.en: new hair, tissue, or cells that grow back after loss or injury
definition.zh: （毛发、组织或细胞的）再生部分；长回来的新生部分

examples.en: The doctor said the regrowths of tissue looked normal.
examples.zh: 医生说组织的再生看起来很正常。

examples.en: Some people notice regrowths of hair after changing their routine.
examples.zh: 有些人在改变护理习惯后会注意到头发有再生。

extraExplanation: “regrowths”是可数名词复数形式，常用于描述多个地点/多处的再生长（如不同区域的林木再生、同一植物多处的新芽）。如果你只谈一个整体过程或现象，更常用不可数或单数形式“regrowth”。

summary.en: “Regs” usually means regulations (rules). It can also mean regulars (frequent customers), depending on context.
summary.zh: “regs”通常指规章制度（regulations）；也可指常客（regulars），要看语境。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “regulations”; official rules, especially in a workplace, school, or the military.
definition.zh: （非正式）“regulations”的缩写；规章制度、官方规定（常见于工作场所、学校或军队等语境）。

examples.en: Make sure your report follows the company regs.
examples.zh: 确保你的报告符合公司的规定。

examples.en: In the army, dress regs are taken seriously.
examples.zh: 在军队里，着装规定很严格。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “regulars”; people who come to a place often (for example, a bar, café, or shop).
definition.zh: （非正式）“regulars”的缩写；常客、经常来的人（如酒吧、咖啡馆、商店）。

examples.en: The regs usually arrive around 7 p.m.
examples.zh: 常客们通常晚上七点左右到。

examples.en: She knows all the regs by name.
examples.zh: 她能叫出所有常客的名字。

extraExplanation: “regs”在口语和非正式写作中更常见；正式场合通常直接写“regulations”或“regulars”。
在英式英语/军队语境里很常见搭配：dress regs（着装规定）、uniform regs（制服规定）。

summary.en: “regt” is an abbreviation for “regiment,” a military unit.
summary.zh: “regt”是“regiment（团/团级部队）”的缩写。

definition.en: (abbr.) written abbreviation for “regiment,” a military unit (often used in official names, lists, and historical texts).
definition.zh: （缩写）“regiment（团/团级部队）”的书面缩写，常见于正式名称、清单和历史文献中。

examples.en: He served in the 7th Regt during the war.
examples.zh: 他在战争期间服役于第7团。

examples.en: The museum display lists each Regt and its commander.
examples.zh: 博物馆展板列出了每个团及其指挥官。

extraExplanation: “Regt”多见于英美军队史料、勋章记录、旧报纸、墓碑铭文等较正式或较旧的书面材料中；现代日常英语里更常直接写“regiment”。
英式与美式都能见到“Regt”，但具体编制与命名习惯会因国家与时期而不同。

summary.en: Reguarantee means to guarantee again, especially by renewing or reissuing a guarantee in legal/financial situations.
summary.zh: Reguarantee 指“再次担保/重新提供保证”，多用于法律或金融文件中，表示续签、重新出具担保。

definition.en: to guarantee something again; to provide a new or renewed guarantee (often in a legal or financial context)
definition.zh: 再次担保；重新提供保证/担保（常用于法律或金融语境）

examples.en: The bank asked the parent company to reguarantee the loan after the contract was updated.
examples.zh: 合同更新后，银行要求母公司对该贷款再次提供担保。

examples.en: If the original guarantee expires, the supplier may need to reguarantee the product for another year.
examples.zh: 如果原先的保证到期，供应商可能需要将产品的保修再延长一年（重新担保）。

definition.en: to guarantee someone else’s guarantee; to back a guarantor’s promise (specialized use)
definition.zh: 对他人的担保再担保；为担保人的承诺提供背书（较专业用法）

examples.en: In some deals, a second company reguarantees the obligations to reduce risk for lenders.
examples.zh: 在一些交易中，第二家公司会对相关义务再担保，以降低放贷方的风险。

extraExplanation: “reguarantee”不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是“renew the guarantee / provide a new guarantee / extend the warranty（续保/延保）”。在合同、贷款、担保文件里才更可能看到“reguarantee”。
拼写上常由前缀“re-（再次）”+“guarantee（保证/担保）”构成；是否写作一个词取决于行业文件风格，有时也会写成“re-guarantee”。

summary.en: “Reguaranteed” means “guaranteed again,” usually referring to a renewed warranty or promise.
summary.zh: “Reguaranteed”意为“再次保证/重新担保”，多指续保或重新提供的保证承诺。

definition.en: guaranteed again; given a new or renewed guarantee (often after a repair, return, or policy change).
definition.zh: 再次保证的；重新提供担保/保修承诺的（常见于维修、退货或政策变更之后）。

examples.en: The replacement phone is reguaranteed for one year.
examples.zh: 更换后的手机重新享有一年保修。

examples.en: If the item is repaired, it may be reguaranteed under the updated terms.
examples.zh: 如果商品经过维修，可能会按更新后的条款重新提供保证。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “reguarantee”) to guarantee again; to renew a guarantee.
definition.zh: （reguarantee 的过去式/过去分词）再次保证；续保/重新担保。

examples.en: The company reguaranteed the parts after the inspection.
examples.zh: 检查后，公司对这些零件重新提供了保证。

examples.en: They have reguaranteed the work in writing.
examples.zh: 他们已以书面形式对这项工作重新作出保证。

extraExplanation: “reguaranteed”不是非常常见的标准词形，更常见的表达是“guaranteed again / renewed guarantee / re-warranted（重新保修）”。在合同、售后或保险语境中偶尔会看到“re-guaranteed / reguaranteed”。

summary.en: “Reguaranteeing” means guaranteeing again or renewing a guarantee, often used in business or formal contexts.
summary.zh: “Reguaranteeing”指“再次保证/续保/重新担保”，多见于正式或商业语境。

definition.en: guaranteeing again; renewing a promise, assurance, or warranty after it has already been given
definition.zh: 再次保证；在已经保证/担保过之后再一次作出承诺或续保

examples.en: After the repair, the company is reguaranteeing the product for one more year.
examples.zh: 维修后，公司将为该产品再续保一年。

examples.en: The manager kept reguaranteeing that salaries would be paid on time.
examples.zh: 经理一再保证工资会按时发放。

definition.en: (business/finance) providing a new or renewed guarantee for a loan, contract, or payment
definition.zh: （商业/金融）为贷款、合同或付款提供新的或续期的担保

examples.en: The parent company is reguaranteeing the subsidiary’s debt to reassure investors.
examples.zh: 母公司正为子公司的债务重新提供担保，以安抚投资者。

examples.en: They avoided reguaranteeing the contract without reading the updated terms.
examples.zh: 他们在未阅读更新条款前避免再次为合同作担保。

extraExplanation: “reguaranteeing”是动词“reguarantee”的现在分词/动名词形式（= re- + guarantee）。它在日常英语中不常见，更常见的表达是“guarantee again / renew the guarantee / reaffirm the guarantee”。
书面语中有时会写作“re-guaranteeing”，用连字符帮助读者一眼看出前缀re-（再次）+ guarantee（保证/担保）。

summary.en: “Guarantees” means promises or assurances (noun), or the act of promising/ensuring something (verb).
summary.zh: “Guarantees”表示“保证/担保（名词）”，或“保证/确保（动词）”。

definition.en: a firm promise that something will happen or be true; a written promise to repair/replace a product within a certain time (warranty)
definition.zh: 保证；担保；（书面）保修承诺

examples.en: The company offers a two-year guarantee on this phone.
examples.zh: 这家公司为这款手机提供两年保修。

examples.en: There is no guarantee that prices will go down.
examples.zh: 不能保证价格一定会下降。

definition.en: to promise with confidence; to make something certain
definition.zh: 保证；担保；确保

examples.en: I can’t guarantee you’ll get the job, but I can recommend you.
examples.zh: 我不能保证你一定能得到这份工作，但我可以推荐你。

examples.en: Good preparation doesn’t guarantee success, but it helps a lot.
examples.zh: 充分准备不能保证成功，但会很有帮助。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **reguaranties** 很可能是拼写错误。常见正确形式是：**guarantees**（名词复数或动词三单）。这个词里有不发音的字母组合，容易拼错：guar-an-tee。
名词 **guarantee** 在购物场景常接近“保修”；在更正式/抽象语境里更像“保证（某事必然发生）”。美式英语里也常用 **warranty** 专指“保修条款/保修单”。

summary.en: Guarantee means a promise (or written warranty) that something will happen or be of good quality, and it can also mean to make such a promise.
summary.zh: Guarantee 指对结果或质量的保证（也可指保修/保证书），也可作动词表示“保证、确保”。

definition.en: a promise or written agreement that something will work, be of good quality, or that you will get your money back
definition.zh: 保证；保修；（质量或退款的）担保/保证书

examples.en: This phone comes with a one-year guarantee.
examples.zh: 这部手机有一年的保修。

examples.en: They offer a money-back guarantee if you’re not satisfied.
examples.zh: 如果你不满意，他们提供退款保证。

definition.en: to promise to do something or to make sure something will happen
definition.zh: 保证；担保；确保发生

examples.en: We guarantee delivery within three days.
examples.zh: 我们保证三天内送达。

examples.en: Nothing can guarantee success, but practice helps.
examples.zh: 没有什么能保证成功，但练习会有帮助。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **reguaranty** 不是标准拼写，通常想写的是 **guarantee**。
另一个较少见但确实存在的拼写是 **guaranty**（多见于法律/金融语境，如“担保书、担保责任”），日常英语里更常用 **guarantee**。
词形小提示：**guarantee (n./v.)**，**guaranteed (adj.)**（有保证的），**guarantor (n.)**（担保人）。

summary.en: “Regard” means to consider someone/something in a certain way, or it can mean respect; it’s also used in formal phrases meaning “about.”
summary.zh: “regard”既可表示“认为/看待”，也可作名词表示“尊重”，还可在正式表达中表示“关于”。

definition.en: to think about or consider someone or something in a particular way; to have an opinion about
definition.zh: 把（某人/某事）看作；认为；看待

examples.en: Many people regard her as a talented singer.
examples.zh: 很多人认为她是个有才华的歌手。

examples.en: I regard this decision as a mistake.
examples.zh: 我认为这个决定是个错误。

definition.en: respect and attention; a feeling of admiration
definition.zh: 尊重；敬意；关心

examples.en: He has great regard for his teachers.
examples.zh: 他非常尊敬他的老师。

examples.en: She treats everyone with regard.
examples.zh: 她以尊重的态度对待每个人。

definition.en: in relation to; about (used to introduce a topic)
definition.zh: 关于；就……而言（用于引出话题）

examples.en: I’m calling in regard to your email.
examples.zh: 我打电话是关于你那封邮件的。

examples.en: With regard to safety, please wear a helmet.
examples.zh: 关于安全，请戴头盔。

extraExplanation: “reguard”通常是拼写错误，正确拼写多为“regard”。
常见搭配：regard A as B（把A看作B）；have regard for（尊敬/重视）；in/with regard to（关于……，较正式/书面）。
写作提示：“in regard to/with regard to”偏正式；口语里常用“about”。

summary.en: “reguardant” is not standard; it is usually a misspelling of “regarding” (about; concerning).
summary.zh: “reguardant”不是标准用法；通常是“regarding（关于；就……而言）”的拼写错误。

definition.en: (Common misspelling) Intended word: “regarding” — about; concerning.
definition.zh: （常见拼写错误）通常想写的是 regarding —— 关于；就……而言。

examples.en: I’m writing regarding your recent order.
examples.zh: 我写信是关于你最近的订单。

examples.en: Regarding safety, please wear a helmet.
examples.zh: 关于安全，请佩戴头盔。

definition.en: (Common misspelling) Intended word: “regarding” — thinking about or dealing with a topic.
definition.zh: （常见拼写错误）通常想写的是 regarding —— 考虑到；就某个话题进行处理/讨论。

examples.en: We had a meeting regarding the new schedule.
examples.zh: 我们开会讨论了新日程。

examples.en: She asked a question regarding the homework.
examples.zh: 她问了一个关于作业的问题。

extraExplanation: “reguardant”不是标准英语拼写。最常见的正确形式是 regarding（介词），用于正式邮件、通知、说明等场合，表示“关于”。
拼写提示：regarding 里面是 guard（像“守护”）+ -ing；不要在中间多加一个 u 变成 *reguard*。
如果你本来想表达“阻燃的/延缓的”，可能想写的是 retardant（如 fire-retardant materials 阻燃材料）。

summary.en: “Reguide” means to guide again or redirect someone/something back on track.
summary.zh: “Reguide”表示“再次引导”或“把人/事重新引回正轨”。

definition.en: to guide someone again, especially after they are confused, lost, or off track; to re-explain directions or steps
definition.zh: 再次引导；重新指路（尤指对方迷惑、走错或偏离后再带回正轨）

examples.en: The instructor reguided the class through the first three steps.
examples.zh: 老师带着全班把前三个步骤重新走了一遍。

examples.en: A volunteer reguided us to the correct entrance when we got lost.
examples.zh: 我们迷路后，一位志愿者把我们重新带到正确入口。

definition.en: to redirect or steer something back toward a better goal or method (often used in coaching, teaching, or planning)
definition.zh: 重新引导（把计划、方法或注意力导回更合适的方向）

examples.en: We need to reguide the discussion toward the main topic.
examples.zh: 我们需要把讨论重新引回主题。

examples.en: The coach reguided the team’s strategy after the first half.
examples.zh: 教练在上半场后重新调整并引导球队策略。

extraExplanation: “reguide”由前缀 re-（再次、重新）+ guide（引导）构成，但在日常英语里不算常见。更常见的表达有：guide again（再带一遍）、redirect（改道/重定向）、reorient（重新定向）、steer back（引回）。在写作中用“reguide”会显得偏正式或偏专业。

summary.en: “Reguided” means guided again or redirected to a new direction.
summary.zh: “reguided”表示“重新引导/改方向”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reguide”: to guide someone again, or to guide them in a new direction (often after confusion, error, or changes).
definition.zh: “reguide”的过去式/过去分词：再次引导（某人），或在方向改变、出错、困惑后重新引导到新的方向。

examples.en: After the detour, the tour leader reguided the group back to the main path.
examples.zh: 绕路之后，导游把大家重新带回了主路。

examples.en: The teacher reguided the students when they misunderstood the instructions.
examples.zh: 学生误解了指示后，老师重新引导他们理解。

examples.en: We reguided the project toward a simpler plan.
examples.zh: 我们把项目重新引导到更简单的方案上。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。因此 reguide = guide（引导）+ re-（重新）。这个词在日常口语里不算常见，更常见的替代表达有 redirect（改道/改方向）、guide again（再带一遍）、reorient（重新调整方向/定位）。

summary.en: “Reguiding” means guiding again or redirecting someone (or something) to a better direction.
summary.zh: “reguiding”指“再次引导”或“重新把人/事引向更合适的方向”。

definition.en: the act of guiding someone again, or guiding them in a new direction (present participle/gerund of “reguide”)
definition.zh: 再次引导；重新带领（“reguide”的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: The teacher is reguiding the students through the problem step by step.
examples.zh: 老师正在一步一步地重新引导学生做这道题。

examples.en: After we got lost, the map app started reguiding us to the nearest subway station.
examples.zh: 我们迷路后，地图应用开始重新引导我们去最近的地铁站。

definition.en: redirecting someone’s attention, behavior, or thinking toward a better or safer choice
definition.zh: 把注意力/行为/想法重新引向更好的或更安全的选择

examples.en: The counselor focused on reguiding him away from risky habits.
examples.zh: 辅导员专注于把他从高风险习惯中重新引导出来。

examples.en: Try reguiding the conversation back to the main topic.
examples.zh: 试着把谈话重新引回到主题上。

extraExplanation: “re-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。因此 reguide = re-（重新）+ guide（引导）。在学习/教学、导航软件、咨询辅导等语境里很常用。

summary.en: regul- is a root meaning “rule; make orderly,” used in words like regulate/regular.
summary.zh: regul- 是表示“规则；使有秩序”的词根，常见于 regulate/regular 等词。

definition.en: a word part (root) meaning “rule” or “make orderly,” seen in words like regulate and regular.
definition.zh: 词根/词素，表示“规则、使有秩序”，常见于 regulate、regular 等词中。

examples.en: The root regul- appears in the word regulate, meaning “to control by rules.”
examples.zh: regul- 这个词根出现在 regulate 中，意思是“用规则来管控”。

examples.en: Regular comes from the same root and can mean “following a rule or pattern.”
examples.zh: regular 同源，也可以表示“遵循规则或规律的”。

extraExplanation:
regul- 来自拉丁语 regula（“尺、规矩、规则”）。所以很多含 regul- 的词都和“规则、管理、规律、正常”相关：regulate（监管/调节）、regulation（法规/规章）、regular（规律的/正常的）、irregular（不规律的/不规则的）。

如果你本来想查的是 regular 或 regulate，请告诉我你想要哪个，我可以给出更完整的释义和用法。

summary.en: Regula is a rare Latin-based word meaning “rule” or “guideline,” especially in academic or religious contexts.
summary.zh: Regula 是一个较少见的拉丁语借词，意为“规则/准则”，多用于学术或宗教语境。

definition.en: (Rare, from Latin) a rule, guideline, or standard; sometimes used in academic, legal, or religious phrases to mean “rule.”
definition.zh: （罕见，源自拉丁语）规则、准则、标准；常见于学术、法律或宗教语境中，表示“规则”。

examples.en: In Latin, regula means “rule” or “guideline.”
examples.zh: 在拉丁语中，regula 的意思是“规则”或“准则”。

examples.en: Some writers discuss the “regula” of a tradition, meaning its guiding principle.
examples.zh: 有些作者谈到某个传统的“regula”，指它的指导原则。

definition.en: A religious rule or code of life followed by a community (especially in Christian history).
definition.zh: （宗教）修会或群体遵循的生活规章、戒律（尤指基督宗教传统中）。

examples.en: The community lived under a strict regula that shaped daily routines.
examples.zh: 这个团体遵循严格的规章，规定了日常作息。

examples.en: Texts may mention a regula to describe how monks should live and pray.
examples.zh: 一些文本会提到 regula，用来说明修士应如何生活与祈祷。

extraExplanation: “regula”在现代英语里不算常用单词，更常作为拉丁语原词出现在固定搭配或学术写作中。你可能会见到如“regula fidei”（信仰准则）这类表达。
同源词包括：rule（规则）、regular（规律的/定期的）、regulate（管理/调节）。理解这个词根 reg-（引导、规则）有助于记忆相关词汇。

summary.en: Regulable means “able to be regulated or adjusted.”
summary.zh: regulable 表示“可被规范或调节的；可调整的”。

definition.en: Able to be regulated, controlled, or adjusted according to rules or needs.
definition.zh: 可被规范、控制或调节的；可调整的。

examples.en: The device has a regulable temperature setting for different kinds of food.
examples.zh: 这个设备有可调节的温度设置，适合不同种类的食物。

examples.en: In many industries, emissions must be regulable and measurable.
examples.zh: 在许多行业中，排放必须是可被管控且可测量的。

extraExplanation: “Regulable”在日常口语中不算常见，更常出现在技术、工程、法律或政策语境里，表示“可以通过规则/机制来控制或调整”。日常表达里更常用“adjustable”（可调的）或“controllable”（可控的）。
词形理解：regulate（v. 规范/调节）+ -able（可……的）→ regulable（可被规范/调节的）。

summary.en: Regular commonly means routine or happening often, standard (not special), or consistent/steady; as a noun, it means a frequent customer.
summary.zh: regular 常指“例行的/经常的”“普通标准的”“规律稳定的”；作名词时指“常客”。

definition.en: happening often or on a fixed schedule; usual or routine
definition.zh: 经常发生的；按固定时间进行的；惯常的、例行的

examples.en: I take the subway as part of my regular routine.
examples.zh: 我把坐地铁当作日常固定的习惯。

examples.en: The store is open during regular business hours.
examples.zh: 这家店在正常营业时间开放。

definition.en: normal or standard; not special, extra, or unusual
definition.zh: 普通的；标准的；不是特别的/额外的/异常的

examples.en: A regular coffee is cheaper than a large one.
examples.zh: 普通杯咖啡比大杯便宜。

examples.en: It was a regular Tuesday—nothing exciting happened.
examples.zh: 那就是一个普通的星期二——没发生什么刺激的事。

definition.en: even, consistent, or not changing much (often about shapes, patterns, or actions)
definition.zh: 均匀的；有规律的；稳定一致的（常指形状、图案或动作）

examples.en: The nurse checked that his heartbeat was regular.
examples.zh: 护士确认他的心跳很规律。

examples.en: Draw regular lines with equal spacing.
examples.zh: 画间距相等的规律线条。

definition.en: a person who comes to a place often (a frequent customer or familiar visitor)
definition.zh: 常客；老主顾

examples.en: She’s a regular at the neighborhood café.
examples.zh: 她是那家社区咖啡馆的常客。

examples.en: The bartender knows many regulars by name.
examples.zh: 酒吧调酒师能叫出很多常客的名字。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，点饮料时的“a regular coffee”常指“普通规格/常规做法”的咖啡，具体含义会因店而异：可能是中杯（medium）或默认配方（例如不加特殊风味）。如果不确定，可以说：“What does ‘regular’ mean here?”（你们这儿的 regular 是指什么？）
语法/词汇联想：regular vs. usual（都可表示“经常的/惯常的”，但 regular 更强调“有固定规律或频率”；usual 更强调“典型/平常”）

summary.en: “Regular” means normal/standard or happening often in an even, scheduled way; it can also mean a frequent customer.
summary.zh: “regular”表示“正常/标准的”或“经常且有规律的、定期的”；也可作名词指“常客”。

definition.en: Following a usual pattern; normal or standard; happening often and evenly.
definition.zh: 遵循常见规律的；正常的/标准的；经常且有规律地发生的。

examples.en: I go to the gym on a regular schedule.
examples.zh: 我按固定的时间表去健身房。

examples.en: It’s important to get regular sleep.
examples.zh: 规律睡眠很重要。

definition.en: Average or ordinary; not special or unusual.
definition.zh: 普通的；一般的；不特别的。

examples.en: Just a regular coffee, please.
examples.zh: 请来一杯普通咖啡。

examples.en: He’s a regular person with a regular job.
examples.zh: 他是个普通人，有一份普通的工作。

definition.en: Occurring at fixed times; repeated in a steady way.
definition.zh: 定期的；按固定时间发生的；稳定重复的。

examples.en: The bus runs at regular intervals.
examples.zh: 公交车按固定间隔发车。

definition.en: A frequent customer or usual attendee.
definition.zh: 常客；老主顾。

examples.en: She’s a regular at this café.
examples.zh: 她是这家咖啡馆的常客。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“regulare”通常是拼写错误；正确拼写多为 **regular**。
词汇搭配很常见：**regular exercise（规律运动）**、**regular customer（常客）**、**regularly（adv. 经常地/有规律地）**。
在英式/美式口语里，点饮料时说 **a regular** 有时指“默认大小/常规款”（具体含义看店铺习惯）。

summary.en: Regular means usual or happening on a steady schedule; as a noun, a regular is a frequent customer.
summary.zh: regular 表示“通常的/规律的”；作名词时指“常客”。

definition.en: usual or normal; happening in a steady, expected way
definition.zh: 通常的；正常的；按固定规律发生的

examples.en: I take the regular bus to school.
examples.zh: 我坐平时那班公交去学校。

examples.en: Try to keep regular sleep hours.
examples.zh: 尽量保持规律的作息时间。

definition.en: done often and on a fixed schedule (not occasional)
definition.zh: 经常的；定期的（不是偶尔的）

examples.en: She has regular meetings with her teacher.
examples.zh: 她会定期和老师开会。

examples.en: Regular exercise can improve your health.
examples.zh: 规律运动能改善你的健康。

definition.en: a normal customer or member who comes often (a ‘regular’)
definition.zh: 常客；老主顾（regular 的名词用法）

examples.en: He’s a regular at that coffee shop.
examples.zh: 他是那家咖啡店的常客。

examples.en: The bartender knows all the regulars.
examples.zh: 酒保认识所有的常客。

extraExplanation: “regulares”本身更常见于西班牙语，是形容词“regular（规律的/普通的）”的复数形式，表示“（他们/它们）是规律的/正常的”。如果你想查英文，最接近的是“regular”（形容词）或“regulars”（名词复数：常客们）。

summary.en: Regularia refers to the official clothing and identifying items of members of a religious order (monks, friars, nuns).
summary.zh: Regularia 指修会成员的正式服饰与标志性用品（如会衣、长袍、徽记）。

definition.en: (often plural in meaning) The distinctive clothing and items (habit, robe, insignia) worn by members of a religious order; the official dress of “regular” clergy (monks, friars, nuns).
definition.zh: （常作复数意义）修会成员（如修士、修女、托钵修会成员）所穿的制服与标志物（如会衣、长袍、徽记）；“正规”教士（隶属修会者）的正式服饰。

examples.en: In the museum, the regularia of several monastic orders are displayed behind glass.
examples.zh: 在博物馆里，几种修会的会衣等 regularia 被陈列在玻璃柜中。

examples.en: The novice received her regularia during the ceremony and began life in the convent.
examples.zh: 在仪式中，她领受了会衣等 regularia，开始了修道院生活。

extraExplanation: “regularia”源自拉丁语，字面与“规则/规章”（rule）相关；在教会语境里，“regular clergy”指遵守修会规章生活的修会人员（如修士、修女），与“secular clergy”（教区神职人员）相对。
在学术写作中常与“secularia”对举：regularia（修会的服饰/器物） vs secularia（教区或世俗神职人员的服饰/器物）。
该词在现代日常英语中较少见，多出现在宗教史、教会法、博物馆/文物说明等语境。

summary.en: Regularis is a Latin adjective meaning “regular/according to a rule,” used mainly in scholarly or scientific contexts.
summary.zh: regularis 是拉丁语形容词，意为“规律的/合乎规则的”，主要见于学术或科学语境。

definition.en: a Latin word meaning “regular,” “according to a rule,” or “normal”; sometimes used in scientific or scholarly contexts (e.g., in species names or Latin descriptions).
definition.zh: 拉丁语词，意为“规则的、规律的、正常的”；有时用于科学或学术语境（如物种命名或拉丁文描述）。

examples.en: In some older biology texts, you may see Latin descriptions using words like regularis.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的生物学文献中，你可能会看到拉丁文描述中使用 regularis 这类词。

examples.en: The term regularis is often best understood as “regular/typical” in context.
examples.zh: regularis 通常结合上下文理解为“规律的/典型的”。

extraExplanation: regularis 主要是拉丁语形容词，来自 regula（“规则、准则”）。现代英语里更常用 regular；regularis 多见于拉丁语原文、古典学/神学写作，或生物分类学中作为拉丁化词形出现在学名或描述里。
如果你是在某个具体句子或学名里看到 regularis，把那一整段（或物种名称）贴出来，我可以帮你按语境确定更准确的含义。

summary.en: Regularise means to make something more regular or standard, or to make an irregular situation official/valid (and in technical fields, to apply regularization).
summary.zh: Regularise 指使事物变得规律、统一或标准化；也可指把不合规的情况补办手续使其合法有效（技术领域还指“正则化”处理）。

definition.en: to make something regular, even, or consistent; to standardize or bring under a fixed rule or system
definition.zh: 使……变得规律/统一；使标准化；使纳入固定制度或规则

examples.en: The company regularised its working hours to reduce overtime.
examples.zh: 公司把工作时间制度化，以减少加班。

examples.en: New guidelines were introduced to regularise safety checks across all sites.
examples.zh: 推出了新指南，以统一所有场地的安全检查。

definition.en: to make something valid or official by correcting it or putting it into legal form
definition.zh: 使（原本不合规/不正式的事）合法化或正规化；补办手续使其有效

examples.en: He applied to regularise his immigration status.
examples.zh: 他申请把自己的移民身份正规化（补齐手续使其合法有效）。

examples.en: The school asked parents to regularise the missing documents.
examples.zh: 学校要求家长补齐缺失的文件，使手续完备。

definition.en: (specialized) to make a problem, equation, or method more stable or well-behaved, often by adding constraints
definition.zh: （专业）对（问题/方程/方法）做正则化处理，使其更稳定、更“良态”，常通过加入约束实现

examples.en: The algorithm regularises the model to prevent overfitting.
examples.zh: 该算法对模型做正则化，以防止过拟合。

examples.en: They regularised the solution by adding a small penalty term.
examples.zh: 他们通过加入一个小的惩罚项来正则化解。

extraExplanation: “regularise”常见于英式拼写（-ise）。在美式英语中更常写作“regularize”（-ize），意思相同。
在移民、文件、行政流程语境里，“regularise”常指“把原本不合规的状态变得合法/手续齐全”，类似“rectify/bring into compliance”。
在数学、统计与机器学习里，“regularise”对应“regularization（正则化）”，用于提升稳定性、减少过拟合。

summary.en: Regularitas is a Latin-derived noun meaning “regularity” or “rule-based order,” mostly seen in academic or historical contexts.
summary.zh: Regularitas 是源自拉丁语的名词，意为“规律性/合乎规章的秩序”，多见于学术或历史语境。

definition.en: regularity; the quality of being consistent, orderly, or following a rule (often used as a Latin term in academic or historical writing).
definition.zh: 规律性；规整性；遵循规则的性质（常见于学术或历史语境中的拉丁语用法）。

examples.en: The report emphasized the regularitas of the patient’s heartbeat.
examples.zh: 报告强调了病人心跳的规律性。

examples.en: In medieval texts, regularitas often referred to strict obedience to a religious rule.
examples.zh: 在中世纪文献中，regularitas 常指严格遵守修会戒律。

extraExplanation: “regularitas”是拉丁语，来自 regularis（“按规则的、规整的”）。在英语里它不算常用日常词，更常出现在历史、宗教研究（如修会戒律/纪律）或学术写作中，用来表达“规律性/合乎规章”。日常英语更常用 regularity。

summary.en: Regularities means repeated patterns or consistent, predictable features—often discovered in data, language, behavior, or systems.
summary.zh: regularities 指反复出现、稳定可预测的模式或特征，常用于描述数据、语言、行为或系统中的规律。

definition.en: Repeated patterns or consistent features found in something (often used in science, language, data, or daily life).
definition.zh: （常指在科学、语言、数据或日常生活中发现的）规律性；反复出现的模式；一致的特征。

examples.en: Researchers looked for regularities in the weather data.
examples.zh: 研究人员在天气数据中寻找规律性。

examples.en: Kids learn language by noticing regularities in what they hear.
examples.zh: 孩子通过注意听到的语言中的规律来学习语言。

examples.en: The regularities of his routine made him feel calm.
examples.zh: 他日常作息的规律性让他感到安心。

definition.en: Predictable rules or systematic patterns, especially in mathematics, logic, or grammar.
definition.zh: （尤指数学、逻辑或语法中的）可预测的规则；系统性的规律。

examples.en: The model depends on regularities in the sequence of numbers.
examples.zh: 这个模型依赖于数列中的规律。

examples.en: English has some regularities in spelling, but also many exceptions.
examples.zh: 英语拼写有一些规律，但也有很多例外。

extraExplanation: “regularities”是名词复数，单数是“regularity”。在学术写作里常用来表示“可总结出的规律/模式”，语气比“patterns（模式）”更强调“稳定、可预测”。
常见搭配：regularities in data/behavior/language（数据/行为/语言中的规律）；discover/identify regularities（发现/识别规律）；follow regularities（遵循规律）。

summary.en: Regularity means a consistent, predictable pattern or the state of being orderly/normal; in grammar it can mean following standard rules.
summary.zh: Regularity 指“规律性/一致性”或“秩序正常”；在语法中也可指“遵循常规规则的规则性”。

definition.en: the quality of happening in a steady, predictable pattern; consistency
definition.zh: 规律性；有规律发生的特性；一致性

examples.en: She goes for a walk every morning with impressive regularity.
examples.zh: 她每天早上都去散步，规律性令人印象深刻。

examples.en: Good sleep regularity can improve your mood and focus.
examples.zh: 良好的睡眠规律性可以改善情绪和专注力。

definition.en: the state of being normal or well-ordered; orderliness
definition.zh: 正常状态；秩序井然

examples.en: After the holiday rush, the office returned to regularity.
examples.zh: 假期忙乱过后，办公室恢复了正常与秩序。

definition.en: in grammar, the fact that a word follows the standard rule (for example, regular past tense forms)
definition.zh: （语法）规则性：词形变化遵循常规规则（如规则过去式）

examples.en: Teachers often highlight the regularity of verbs like “walk—walked.”
examples.zh: 老师常强调像“walk—walked”这类动词的规则性。

extraExplanation: “regularity”来自“regular（有规律的、规则的）+ -ity（名词后缀，表示性质/状态）”。日常用法里它常和时间、习惯、作息搭配：regularity of meals（饮食规律）、training regularity（训练规律性）。
语法语境中，它常与“irregularity（不规则）”对比，用来讨论动词、名词复数等是否遵循一般变化规则。

summary.en: Regularization means making something follow a standard rule; in machine learning it means adding a penalty to reduce overfitting; in law it can mean making a legal status official.
summary.zh: regularization 指“规范化/规则化”；在机器学习中指“加入惩罚项的正则化以减少过拟合”；在法律/移民语境中也可指“使身份合法化/正规化”。

definition.en: The act of making something follow a consistent rule, standard, or normal pattern; the process of making something regular.
definition.zh: 使某事遵循一致规则或标准、变得规律化/规范化的过程。

examples.en: The new policy aims at the regularization of working hours across departments.
examples.zh: 新政策旨在让各部门的工作时间实现统一规范。

examples.en: Regularization helps reduce confusion by making procedures consistent.
examples.zh: 规范化通过让流程一致来减少混乱。

definition.en: (Math/Statistics/Machine Learning) A method that adds a penalty or constraint to a model to prevent overfitting and improve generalization.
definition.zh: （数学/统计/机器学习）通过加入惩罚项或约束来防止过拟合、提升泛化能力的方法。

examples.en: We used L2 regularization to keep the model weights small.
examples.zh: 我们使用了 L2 正则化来让模型权重保持较小。

examples.en: Regularization can improve performance on new data, not just on the training set.
examples.zh: 正则化能提升模型在新数据上的表现，而不只是在训练集上。

examples.en: Without regularization, the model may memorize noise instead of learning patterns.
examples.zh: 没有正则化，模型可能会记住噪声而不是学到规律。

definition.en: (Government/Law, often in immigration) The process of making a person’s legal status official or valid; legalization.
definition.zh: （政府/法律，常见于移民语境）使某人的身份或居留变为正式合法的程序；合法化。

examples.en: The program offers regularization for undocumented workers who meet certain conditions.
examples.zh: 该项目为符合条件的无证工人提供身份合法化途径。

examples.en: She applied for the regularization of her residency status.
examples.zh: 她申请将自己的居留身份正规化/合法化。

extraExplanation: “regularization”来自“regular（规则的、规律的）+ -ization（……化/过程）”。在日常英语里常指“规范化”；在机器学习语境里几乎等同于“正则化”，常见搭配有 L1 regularization、L2 regularization、ridge（岭回归，常对应L2）、lasso（套索回归，常对应L1）。
法律/移民语境中，它常带有政策含义：把原本“非正规/不合法”的状态通过程序变为“合法/受承认”。不同国家的具体政策差异很大。

summary.en: Regularize means to make something more regular or standardized, or to make a status official/legal.
summary.zh: Regularize 指使事物更有规律、更标准化，或使身份/手续变得正式合法。

definition.en: to make something follow a regular rule, pattern, or schedule; to standardize
definition.zh: 使某事遵循固定规则/模式/时间表；使标准化、规范化

examples.en: The company regularized its work hours so everyone started at 9 a.m.
examples.zh: 公司把工作时间规范化，让大家都在早上9点开始上班。

examples.en: The teacher tried to regularize the spelling in students’ essays.
examples.zh: 老师试图把学生作文里的拼写统一规范。

definition.en: to make a person’s or group’s status official or legal
definition.zh: 使某人/某群体的身份变得正式或合法；使手续合法化

examples.en: The new policy helped many workers regularize their immigration status.
examples.zh: 新政策帮助许多工人将移民身份正规化（合法化）。

examples.en: She hired a lawyer to regularize the paperwork for her business.
examples.zh: 她请了律师来把公司手续办齐、办规范。

extraExplanation: “regularize”常见于较正式的语境（政府、法律、管理、学术）。日常口语里更常用“standardize（标准化）”“make ... regular（让……规律）”“legalize（合法化）”“normalize（使正常化/常态化）”，具体用哪个取决于重点是“规则/标准”还是“合法身份/手续”。

summary.en: Regularized means made more standard/consistent—or, in math and machine learning, made more stable by adding constraints or penalties.
summary.zh: regularized 指被规范化/标准化；在数学与机器学习中也指通过加入约束或惩罚项使解或模型更稳定（正则化）。

definition.en: Made regular, standard, or consistent; brought into a normal or orderly form.
definition.zh: 使规律化、标准化或一致；使之正常化、有秩序。

examples.en: The company regularized its work schedule so everyone started at 9 a.m.
examples.zh: 公司把工作时间表规范化，让大家都在早上9点开始上班。

examples.en: After the policy change, the government regularized many workers’ legal status.
examples.zh: 政策改变后，政府将许多工人的合法身份正规化。

definition.en: (Math/Statistics/Machine Learning) Adjusted by adding constraints or a penalty to make a model or solution more stable and less likely to overfit.
definition.zh: （数学/统计/机器学习）通过加入约束或惩罚项来使模型或解更稳定、降低过拟合风险。

examples.en: A regularized regression model can perform better on new data.
examples.zh: 正则化回归模型在新数据上的表现往往更好。

examples.en: They used a regularized objective function to reduce noise in the results.
examples.zh: 他们使用正则化的目标函数来减少结果中的噪声。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “regularize”: to make something regular, standard, or legal.
definition.zh: “regularize”的过去式/过去分词：使……规范化、标准化或合法化。

examples.en: The team regularized the data before training the model.
examples.zh: 团队在训练模型之前对数据进行了规范化处理。

extraExplanation: 在机器学习里，“regularized（正则化的）”常指在损失函数里加上惩罚项（如 L1/L2），用来限制模型复杂度，从而提升泛化能力、减少过拟合。常见搭配：regularized regression（正则化回归）、regularized loss/objective（正则化损失/目标函数）。

summary.en: A regularizer is something that makes things more regular or stable; in machine learning, it’s an added penalty term that prevents overly complex models.
summary.zh: regularizer 指使事物更规整或更稳定的因素；在机器学习中常指加入的“惩罚/正则项”，用来防止模型过于复杂。

definition.en: Something that makes a system more regular, stable, or standardized (for example, a rule, device, or method).
definition.zh: 使系统更“规整”、更稳定或更标准化的东西（例如规则、装置或方法）。

examples.en: Daily routines can act as a regularizer for people who feel stressed.
examples.zh: 日常作息对感到压力的人来说可以起到“稳定器/规律化因素”的作用。

examples.en: The policy served as a regularizer to keep procedures consistent across departments.
examples.zh: 这项政策起到规范作用，让各部门的流程保持一致。

definition.en: (Statistics / machine learning) A term added to a model’s objective (loss) to discourage overly complex solutions and improve generalization.
definition.zh: （统计/机器学习）加到模型目标函数（损失）中的一项，用来抑制过于复杂的解、提升泛化能力。

examples.en: Adding an L2 regularizer helped reduce overfitting on the training data.
examples.zh: 加入 L2 正则项有助于减少对训练数据的过拟合。

examples.en: They tuned the regularizer strength to balance accuracy and simplicity.
examples.zh: 他们调节正则项强度，以平衡准确率和模型简洁性。

extraExplanation: 在机器学习里，regularizer 常被译为“正则项/正则化项”。常见的有 L1（促使参数变稀疏）和 L2（倾向让参数更小、更平滑）。它通常写成“loss + λ·regularizer”，其中 λ（lambda）控制正则化强度。
在一些工程语境中，regularizer 也可能指“稳压/稳流”之类的装置或机制，但更常见的工程术语通常会直接用 regulator（调节器/稳压器）。注意 regularizer 与 regulator 在含义和用法上不完全一样。

summary.en: “Regularizes” means “makes something more regular, consistent, or standardized,” and it can also mean “applies regularization” in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “regularizes”意为“使……规律化/一致化/规范化”，在技术语境中也可指“对……进行正则化处理”。

definition.en: to make something follow a regular pattern or schedule; to make it more consistent or orderly
definition.zh: 使某事变得有规律；使更一致、更有条理

examples.en: She regularizes her sleep schedule by going to bed at the same time every night.
examples.zh: 她通过每天晚上同一时间上床来把作息规律化。

examples.en: The company regularizes payments so employees are paid on the first of each month.
examples.zh: 公司把付款制度规范化，让员工每月一号领薪。

definition.en: to standardize or formalize something (such as rules, procedures, or a system) so it follows an accepted norm
definition.zh: 将（规则、流程或制度等）标准化／规范化，使其符合通行标准

examples.en: The city regularizes street names to match national mapping standards.
examples.zh: 该市将街道名称规范化，以符合国家测绘标准。

examples.en: The new policy regularizes the application process across all departments.
examples.zh: 新政策使各部门的申请流程统一规范。

definition.en: (in math/science) to modify a model or equation to make it better-behaved or more stable, often by adding constraints
definition.zh: （数理/科学）对模型或方程进行正则化处理，使其更稳定或更“良性”（常通过加入约束）

examples.en: The algorithm regularizes the model to reduce overfitting.
examples.zh: 该算法对模型做正则化以减少过拟合。

examples.en: The method regularizes noisy data so the results are more reliable.
examples.zh: 该方法对噪声数据进行正则化处理，使结果更可靠。

extraExplanation: “regularizes”是动词“regularize”的第三人称单数（he/she/it regularizes）。常见时态：regularize（原形），regularized（过去式/过去分词），regularizing（现在分词）。
英式拼写常见为“regularise”。含义相同，只是拼写差异。
在日常语境里更偏“让……变得规律/一致”；在行政或制度语境里常译“规范化/标准化”；在机器学习等技术语境里通常对应“正则化（regularization）”。

summary.en: Regularizing means making something more regular or standardized; in math/stats it often means adding constraints to stabilize a model; it can also mean making a situation official or legal.
summary.zh: regularizing 指让事物更有规律或更标准化；在数学/统计中常指通过加入约束使模型更稳定（正则化）；也可指把某种情况手续补齐使其正式或合法。

definition.en: making something follow a regular pattern, rule, or schedule; standardizing it
definition.zh: 使某事遵循固定的规律、规则或时间安排；使之标准化

examples.en: The company is regularizing its work hours so everyone starts at 9 a.m.
examples.zh: 公司正在把工作时间规范化，让大家都在早上九点开始上班。

examples.en: We are regularizing the file names to make them easier to search.
examples.zh: 我们正在统一文件命名规则，让它们更容易搜索。

definition.en: (statistics/math) adding rules or a penalty to a model to reduce overfitting and make results more stable
definition.zh: （统计/数学）对模型加入约束或惩罚项，以减少过拟合并让结果更稳定

examples.en: The team is regularizing the model to improve how it performs on new data.
examples.zh: 团队正在对模型做正则化，以提升它在新数据上的表现。

examples.en: Regularizing can help when the dataset is small or noisy.
examples.zh: 当数据集很小或噪声很多时，正则化会很有帮助。

definition.en: making an unusual or unofficial situation legal, official, or properly documented
definition.zh: 使不规范或非正式的情况合法化、正式化或补齐手续

examples.en: The city is regularizing informal housing by issuing permits.
examples.zh: 市政府正在通过发放许可来把非正规住房手续正规化。

examples.en: They are regularizing their status with the necessary paperwork.
examples.zh: 他们正在通过必要的文件来使身份手续正规化。

extraExplanation: “regularizing”是动词 regularize 的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（is/are regularizing）或作名词用（Regularizing takes time）。
在机器学习语境里，regularizing 常指“正则化”，常见相关词有 L1/L2 regularization、ridge（岭回归）、lasso（套索回归）。
在移民/行政或城市治理语境里，regularize/regularizing 往往表示“补手续使合法/合规”，比单纯的“整理”更强调“依法依规”。

summary.en: Regularly means doing something often or on a predictable schedule, and it can also mean in a steady, consistent way.
summary.zh: regularly 表示“经常/定期地”，也可表示“稳定、有规律地（不忽快忽慢）”。

definition.en: In a way that happens often or on a set schedule; frequently.
definition.zh: 经常地；按固定规律/时间表地。

examples.en: I exercise regularly, three times a week.
examples.zh: 我规律地锻炼，一周三次。

examples.en: The bus runs regularly during the day.
examples.zh: 白天公交车按时（有规律地）运行。

definition.en: In an even, consistent way; without unusual changes.
definition.zh: 有规律地；均匀、稳定地（没有明显波动）。

examples.en: Her heart was beating regularly again.
examples.zh: 她的心跳又恢复得很规律了。

examples.en: Water the plants regularly so they don’t dry out.
examples.zh: 要定期浇水，植物才不会干枯。

extraExplanation: “regularly”既可以表示“频率高/常常”，也可以强调“按固定周期/时间表”。例如：regularly visit（经常去） vs. regularly scheduled（定期安排的）。
常见搭配：regularly check（定期检查）、meet regularly（定期见面）、regularly updated（定期更新）、eat regularly（按时吃饭）。

summary.en: Regularness means the quality of being regular—consistent, even, or following a steady pattern or schedule.
summary.zh: Regularness 指“规律性/规则性”，强调一致、稳定，或遵循固定模式与时间安排。

definition.en: the quality or state of being regular (having a consistent pattern, schedule, shape, or behavior)
definition.zh: 规律性；规则性；一致性（指模式、时间安排、形状或行为等保持稳定、固定）

examples.en: Sleep regularness can improve your energy and mood.
examples.zh: 睡眠的规律性可以提升你的精力和情绪。

examples.en: The teacher liked the regularness of his handwriting.
examples.zh: 老师喜欢他字迹的工整与一致。

definition.en: (less common) the degree to which something happens repeatedly or predictably
definition.zh: （较少用）某事发生的频率与可预测程度

examples.en: They tracked the regularness of the buses over a month.
examples.zh: 他们跟踪记录了公交车一个月来的准点规律性。

examples.en: The regularness of her visits made everyone feel cared for.
examples.zh: 她探望的规律性让大家觉得被关心。

extraExplanation: “regularness”在现代英语里相对少见，更常用、也更自然的对应词是“regularity”。例如更常说“sleep regularity / the regularity of the buses”。不过“regularness”仍然可以被理解，语气更口语、也更直观。

summary.en: “Regulars” usually means people who visit a place frequently (regular customers). It can also mean the usual/standard ones (plural of “regular”).
summary.zh: “regulars”通常指常去某地的常客；也可指常规的/通常的事物（regular 的复数）。

definition.en: people who come to a place often (especially a shop, café, bar, gym, etc.); frequent customers or familiar members of a group
definition.zh: （常去某地的）常客；老主顾；固定成员

examples.en: The café is small, but the regulars make it feel like a community.
examples.zh: 这家咖啡馆很小，但常客让它有一种社区的感觉。

examples.en: He’s a regular at the neighborhood bar, so everyone knows his name.
examples.zh: 他是附近酒吧的常客，所以大家都认识他。

definition.en: things or people considered normal, usual, or standard in a situation (plural of “regular”)
definition.zh: 常规的事物；通常的人/事（regular 的复数）

examples.en: Most of the regulars are back at work after the holiday.
examples.zh: 假期后，大多数“平时的人/常规人员”都回去上班了。

examples.en: The store has weekend specials, but the regulars are still popular.
examples.zh: 这家店周末有特价，但常规款还是很受欢迎。

extraExplanation: “the regulars”在英语里很常见，常指某家店里“总会出现的那一群人”。语气通常中性或带一点亲切感。

summary.en: “Regulatable” means “able to be regulated or controlled; adjustable.”
summary.zh: “regulatable”意为“可被监管/可被控制的；可调节的”。

definition.en: Able to be regulated—able to be controlled, adjusted, or kept within limits (often used in technical or legal contexts). Example: “The heater has a regulatable thermostat.” / “这台取暖器有一个可调控的恒温器。”
definition.zh: 可被调节或管控的；可被控制、调整或限制在一定范围内的（常见于技术或法律语境）。例："The heater has a regulatable thermostat." / "这台取暖器有一个可调控的恒温器。"

examples.en: The flow rate is regulatable, so the machine can run safely.
examples.zh: 流量是可调控的，所以机器能安全运行。

examples.en: Some online content is regulatable under local laws.
examples.zh: 某些网络内容在当地法律下是可受监管的。

extraExplanation: “regulatable”由 regulate（监管/调节）+ -able（“可……的”后缀）构成，强调“具备被控制/被调整的特性”。在日常英语里更常用的说法通常是 adjustable（可调的）或 controllable（可控制的）；regulatable更偏工程参数、系统设计或法规监管的正式表达。

summary.en: Regulate means to control something by rules or to adjust it so it stays at the right level.
summary.zh: Regulate 指用规则来管理/监管，或把某物调节到合适水平。

definition.en: To control or manage something by using rules, laws, or official actions; to make sure it happens in an orderly way.
definition.zh: 通过规则、法律或官方措施来控制、管理某事；使其有序进行。

examples.en: The government regulates food safety to protect consumers.
examples.zh: 政府监管食品安全以保护消费者。

examples.en: Many countries regulate how banks lend money.
examples.zh: 许多国家会监管银行如何放贷。

definition.en: To adjust something so it works correctly or stays at a desired level (such as temperature, speed, or pressure).
definition.zh: 调节、调整某物，使其正常运转或保持在理想水平（如温度、速度、压力）。

examples.en: This device regulates the flow of water.
examples.zh: 这个装置用来调节水流。

examples.en: Hospitals use machines to regulate a patient’s breathing.
examples.zh: 医院会用机器来调节病人的呼吸。

definition.en: To control a natural process in the body or in nature.
definition.zh: 调控身体或自然界中的过程。

examples.en: The body regulates temperature by sweating.
examples.zh: 身体通过出汗来调节体温。

extraExplanation: regulate 常见于三类语境：①法律/政策（regulate an industry），②机器/系统（regulate temperature/pressure），③生理/自然过程（regulate blood sugar）。根据宾语不同，中文常译为“监管/管制”“调节/调整”“调控”。
词源来自拉丁语 regula（尺规、规则），因此它的核心含义是“用规则让事情保持在合适的范围内”。

summary.en: Regulated means controlled by rules or kept steady by a system.
summary.zh: regulated 指“受规章监管的”，或“被系统调控以保持稳定的”。

definition.en: Controlled by rules or laws; officially managed to keep something safe, fair, or orderly.
definition.zh: 受规章或法律管控的；由官方管理以确保安全、公平或秩序。

examples.en: Banks are heavily regulated to protect customers’ money.
examples.zh: 银行受到严格监管，以保护客户的资金。

examples.en: This is a regulated drug, so you need a prescription.
examples.zh: 这是受管制的药物，所以你需要处方。

examples.en: In many cities, rent increases are regulated by local law.
examples.zh: 在许多城市，房租涨幅受地方法律监管。

definition.en: Kept at a steady, controlled level (often by a device or system).
definition.zh: （常指由装置或系统）被调节并保持在稳定、可控水平的。

examples.en: The room has regulated temperature and humidity.
examples.zh: 这个房间的温度和湿度是恒定调控的。

examples.en: A regulated power supply provides stable voltage.
examples.zh: 稳压电源提供稳定的电压。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “regulate”: to control or manage something by rules or adjustments.
definition.zh: “regulate”的过去式/过去分词：通过规则或调整来控制、管理某事。

examples.en: The government regulated the market to reduce fraud.
examples.zh: 政府监管市场以减少欺诈。

examples.en: Traffic lights are regulated automatically during rush hour.
examples.zh: 高峰期的红绿灯会自动调控。

extraExplanation: “regulated”常见于两类语境：①法律/政策（regulated industry=受监管行业，如金融、医药、能源）；②技术/工程（regulated voltage/temperature=稳压/恒温）。读到时可先判断是在讲“监管”还是“调节稳定”。
与“restricted（受限制的）”相比，“regulated（受监管的）”强调“有规则、有机构在管理”，不一定表示“更少/更难”，而是“按规定进行”。

summary.en: “Regulates” means controls something by rules, or keeps it stable by adjusting it.
summary.zh: “Regulates” 表示用规则来管控，或通过调节来保持稳定。

definition.en: (third-person singular of regulate) to control an activity or system by making rules or laws.
definition.zh: （regulate 的第三人称单数）通过制定规则或法律来管理、规范某项活动或系统。

examples.en: The government regulates food safety standards.
examples.zh: 政府监管食品安全标准。

examples.en: Our school regulates how students use their phones in class.
examples.zh: 我们学校规定学生在课堂上如何使用手机。

definition.en: to keep something working properly by adjusting it; to maintain a steady level (such as temperature, speed, or pressure).
definition.zh: 通过调节使其正常运作；使（温度、速度、压力等）保持稳定。

examples.en: A thermostat regulates the temperature in the room.
examples.zh: 恒温器调节房间的温度。

examples.en: The body regulates blood sugar levels.
examples.zh: 身体会调节血糖水平。

extraExplanation: “regulates” 是动词 “regulate” 的第三人称单数形式，用于 he/she/it 或单数名词作主语（如：The law regulates…）。日常写作中常见搭配：regulate + industry/market/use/behavior（监管行业/市场/使用/行为）；regulate + temperature/pressure/flow（调节温度/压力/流量）。

summary.en: “Regulating” means controlling or adjusting something to keep it within proper limits, or supervising it through rules (especially by governments or agencies).
summary.zh: “regulating”指通过控制或调节让事物保持在合适范围内，也可指（多由政府/机构）以规则来监管某领域。

definition.en: controlling or adjusting something (such as an activity, system, or process) to keep it working properly or within limits; often done by rules or standards
definition.zh: 调节或控制某事物（如活动、系统或过程），使其正常运作或保持在一定范围内；常通过规则或标准来进行

examples.en: Regulating body temperature is one of the most important jobs of the nervous system.
examples.zh: 调节体温是神经系统最重要的工作之一。

examples.en: The government is regulating online advertising to protect consumers.
examples.zh: 政府正在监管网络广告以保护消费者。

examples.en: A thermostat is a device for regulating heat.
examples.zh: 恒温器是一种用来调节温度的装置。

definition.en: the act or process of making rules to control an activity or industry (used as a gerund)
definition.zh: 制定规则来控制某项活动或行业的行为或过程（动名词用法）

examples.en: Regulating the banking system takes careful planning.
examples.zh: 监管银行体系需要周密规划。

examples.en: They are discussing regulating e-cigarettes in public spaces.
examples.zh: 他们正在讨论在公共场所监管电子烟。

definition.en: present participle of regulate: controlling, adjusting, or supervising something
definition.zh: regulate 的现在分词：正在控制、调节或监管某事

examples.en: The agency is regulating pollution levels in the river.
examples.zh: 该机构正在监管河流的污染水平。

examples.en: She is regulating her breathing to stay calm.
examples.zh: 她在调节呼吸让自己保持冷静。

extraExplanation:
“regulating”常见于两类语境：
1）科学/日常：regulating temperature, breathing, blood sugar（调节温度/呼吸/血糖）；强调“把状态调整到合适范围”。
2）社会/法律：regulating banks, markets, advertising（监管银行/市场/广告）；强调“制定或执行规则来管理”。
在写作中，如果主语是政府、机构或法律，多半是“监管”；如果主语是装置或人体功能，多半是“调节”。

summary.en: Regulation most commonly means an official rule, and more generally it can mean the act of controlling or managing something.
summary.zh: regulation 最常见指“官方规章/条例”，也可泛指“监管、管理或调节的过程”。

definition.en: an official rule made by a government, organization, or authority to control how something is done
definition.zh: （政府、机构等制定的）条例；规章；规定，用来规范或控制行为与流程

examples.en: Food safety regulations require restaurants to store meat at safe temperatures.
examples.zh: 食品安全法规要求餐厅把肉类储存在安全温度下。

examples.en: The new regulation limits how much pollution a factory can produce.
examples.zh: 新规定限制工厂可排放的污染量。

definition.en: the act or process of controlling something, especially by using rules or standards
definition.zh: 管理；控制；调节（尤指通过规则、标准或制度来控制）

examples.en: Better regulation of online platforms can help reduce scams.
examples.zh: 对网络平台进行更好的监管有助于减少诈骗。

examples.en: Emotional regulation is the skill of managing your feelings in stressful situations.
examples.zh: 情绪调节是指在压力情境中管理自己情绪的能力。

extraExplanation: “regulation”常与介词搭配：regulation of（对……的监管/调控），regulation on/against（关于/针对……的规定）。在日常语境里，复数 regulations 常指“具体条款”；单数 regulation 也可指“监管/调控”这种总体行为。
相关常见搭配：regulatory agency（监管机构）、comply with regulations（遵守规定）、tighten/loosen regulations（收紧/放松监管）。

summary.en: A regulationist is someone who supports government regulation rather than leaving something unregulated or banning it entirely.
summary.zh: regulationist 指主张用政府规章与监管来管理某事的人，通常不同于主张彻底禁止的人。

definition.en: a person who supports or argues for government regulation of an activity, industry, or behavior (often in debates about alcohol, drugs, or sex work).
definition.zh: 主张（政府）加强监管的人；规制主义者（常见于酒精、毒品或性工作等议题的讨论）。

examples.en: Some regulationists argue that strict licensing can reduce harm.
examples.zh: 一些规制主义者认为，严格的许可制度可以减少危害。

examples.en: In the debate over sex work policy, regulationists favor legal rules and oversight rather than a total ban.
examples.zh: 在性工作政策的争论中，规制主义者更倾向于通过法律规则与监管来管理，而不是全面禁止。

extraExplanation: “regulationist”多用于政策与社会议题语境，强调“通过法律与监管来管理”，不一定等同于“全面禁止”。因此它常与“prohibitionist（禁酒/禁令主义者）”形成对比：prohibitionist主张直接禁止，regulationist主张设定规则、许可、税收、检查等手段来控制与降低风险。
构词法：regulation（监管/规章）+ -ist（……主义者/支持者）。
该词在学术或评论文章中较常见，日常口语里更常说“someone who favors regulation / a pro-regulation person”。

summary.en: “Regulations” means official rules, especially those set by authorities, that people must follow; it can also mean the rules of a sport or activity.
summary.zh: “regulations”指由权威机构制定、必须遵守的正式规定/条例；也可指某项运动或活动的规则。

definition.en: Official rules made by a government, organization, or authority to control how something is done.
definition.zh: （政府、机构或主管部门制定的）正式规章制度；条例，用来规范某事该如何进行。

examples.en: The new safety regulations require workers to wear helmets.
examples.zh: 新的安全条例要求工人必须戴安全帽。

examples.en: Restaurants must follow health regulations to stay open.
examples.zh: 餐馆必须遵守卫生规定才能继续营业。

definition.en: A specific rule or set of rules for a sport, game, or activity (often used in the phrase “under the regulations”).
definition.zh: （体育比赛或某项活动的）规则；章程（常见于短语 under the regulations“按规则”）。

examples.en: Under the regulations, the match will be replayed if the field is unsafe.
examples.zh: 按规则，如果场地不安全，比赛将重赛。

extraExplanation: “Regulations”通常是可数名词复数，指很多条具体规则的集合；更笼统时也可用单数 regulation（如：a regulation on food labeling 一条关于食品标注的规定）。
常见搭配：follow/obey regulations（遵守规定），break/violate regulations（违反规定），comply with regulations（遵循规定，较正式），government/environmental/safety regulations（政府/环保/安全法规）。
与 law 的区别：law（法律）通常更宏观、更高层级；regulations（规章/条例）多为在法律框架下由部门制定的更细的执行细则。

summary.en: Regulative means “serving to regulate or control,” often used in academic contexts; everyday English more often uses regulatory.
summary.zh: Regulative 指“起规制/控制作用的”，多见于学术语境；日常英语更常用 regulatory。

definition.en: Intended to control, guide, or set rules for behavior or processes; regulatory.
definition.zh: 用于控制、引导或制定行为/流程规则的；规制性的、管理性的。

examples.en: The company introduced regulative policies to prevent data leaks.
examples.zh: 公司推出了规制性政策来防止数据泄露。

examples.en: Traffic laws have a regulative function in society.
examples.zh: 交通法规在社会中起到规制作用。

definition.en: In sociology, relating to rules, sanctions, or formal institutions that make people follow norms (often contrasted with “normative” or “cultural-cognitive”).
definition.zh: （社会学）与规则、制裁或正式制度有关，用来促使人们遵守规范（常与“normative 规范性的”或“cultural-cognitive 文化—认知的”对比）。

examples.en: The regulative pillar includes laws and punishments that shape behavior.
examples.zh: 规制性支柱包括法律与惩罚，它们会塑造人们的行为。

examples.en: Regulative mechanisms can be strict even when social norms are relaxed.
examples.zh: 即使社会规范较宽松，规制机制也可能很严格。

extraExplanation: “regulative”比“regulatory”更常见于学术或理论语境（如制度理论：regulative / normative / cultural-cognitive 三支柱）。日常英语里通常用“regulatory”来形容政府监管、条例等。
词根提示：regulate（管理、调节）来自拉丁语 regula（尺规、规则），所以 regulative 的核心含义就是“用规则来约束/引导”。

summary.en: Regulatively means “in a regulatory or rule-enforcing way,” often used in legal, policy, or academic contexts.
summary.zh: regulatively意为“以监管/规则执行的方式”，多用于法律、政策或学术语境。

definition.en: In a way that relates to making or enforcing rules, standards, or controls (especially by authorities or institutions).
definition.zh: 以制定或执行规则、标准或管控的方式（尤指政府或机构层面的监管）。

examples.en: The company must report emissions regulatively, following the government’s guidelines.
examples.zh: 公司必须依照政府指南，以监管要求的方式报告排放数据。

examples.en: Data may be shared only regulatively—when the law clearly permits it.
examples.zh: 数据只能在监管许可的情况下共享——即法律明确允许时。

definition.en: In a way that aims to guide or shape behavior through rules or norms (a more academic use).
definition.zh: 以通过规则或规范来引导、塑造行为的方式（较偏学术用法）。

examples.en: Schools can act regulatively by setting clear policies on bullying.
examples.zh: 学校可以通过制定明确的反霸凌政策来发挥规范引导作用。

examples.en: The policy works regulatively, encouraging safer workplace habits.
examples.zh: 该政策以规范引导的方式发挥作用，鼓励更安全的工作习惯。

extraExplanation: “regulatively”在日常口语中比较少见，更常见的表达是“from a regulatory standpoint / in regulatory terms / under regulations（从监管角度/按监管要求）”。
它来自形容词“regulative（规范性的；调控的）”，常出现在法律、公共政策、社会学或管理学等语境中。

summary.en: Regulator means either a rule-enforcing authority (often government) or a device that keeps something stable (like pressure or voltage).
summary.zh: Regulator 既可指“监管机构/监管者”，也可指“调节装置/稳压装置”（如压力或电压的调节）。

definition.en: a person or organization that controls an activity, industry, or system by making and enforcing rules (often a government agency)
definition.zh: 监管者；监管机构：通过制定并执行规则来管理某项活动、行业或系统的个人或组织（常指政府部门）

examples.en: Bank regulators require financial institutions to follow strict rules.
examples.zh: 银行监管机构要求金融机构遵守严格规定。

examples.en: The regulator investigated the company for safety violations.
examples.zh: 监管部门因安全违规对该公司展开调查。

definition.en: a device that controls or keeps something steady, such as pressure, voltage, temperature, or speed
definition.zh: 调节器；稳压器：用来控制或保持压力、电压、温度或速度等稳定的装置

examples.en: This voltage regulator protects the circuit from power spikes.
examples.zh: 这个稳压器能保护电路免受电压浪涌影响。

examples.en: A gas regulator controls how much gas flows to the stove.
examples.zh: 燃气调压器控制流向炉灶的燃气量。

extraExplanation: 在新闻与商业语境中，regulator 常指“监管机构”，搭配常见：the regulator, a financial/energy/telecom regulator；动词搭配：regulators oversee/monitor/enforce/investigate。
在工程语境中，regulator 多指“调节/稳压装置”，常见复合词：voltage regulator（稳压器）、pressure regulator（调压器）、temperature regulator（温控器）。

summary.en: Regulators are people or agencies that enforce rules, or devices that control and stabilize something.
summary.zh: Regulators可指执行法规的监管者/机构，也可指用于控制并保持稳定的调节装置。

definition.en: a person or organization (often a government agency) that makes sure rules or laws are followed
definition.zh: 监管者；监管机构（常指政府部门），负责确保法规或规则被遵守

examples.en: Financial regulators require banks to keep enough money in reserve.
examples.zh: 金融监管机构要求银行保留足够的准备金。

examples.en: The regulator fined the company for breaking safety rules.
examples.zh: 监管部门因该公司违反安全规定而对其罚款。

definition.en: a device that controls or keeps something stable (such as pressure, speed, temperature, or voltage)
definition.zh: 调节器；稳压器（用于控制或保持压力、速度、温度或电压等稳定的装置）

examples.en: The scuba tank has a regulator that controls the air flow.
examples.zh: 水肺气瓶有一个调节器来控制空气流量。

examples.en: This power supply includes a voltage regulator.
examples.zh: 这个电源包含稳压器。

definition.en: (often capitalized in U.S. history) members of a group that tries to enforce order or “regulate” behavior outside formal government control
definition.zh: （常大写，美国历史）“Regulators”组织成员：在正式政府体系外试图维持秩序、约束行为的人群

examples.en: In some colonies, the Regulators protested corruption and unfair taxes.
examples.zh: 在一些殖民地时期，“Regulators”抗议腐败和不公平税收。

extraExplanation: “regulators”是regulator的复数形式：一个regulator，两个/多个regulators。
在新闻语境里，regulators常指“监管机构/监管部门”（如SEC、FDA等），不一定指具体个人。
写作时如果看到大写“Regulators”，往往是在讲美国历史上的特定群体（如“Regulator Movement”相关）。

summary.en: Regulatorship means the office, authority, or system of a regulator—i.e., the power or role of supervising and controlling something.
summary.zh: Regulatorship 指监管者（或监管机构）的职位、权力或监管体系，即对某事进行监督与管制的角色与权力。

definition.en: the position, authority, or system of a regulator (a person or agency that supervises and controls an industry or activity)
definition.zh: 监管者（或监管机构）的职位、权力或监管体系

examples.en: The company adjusted its compliance program to meet the regulatorship of the new agency.
examples.zh: 公司调整了合规项目，以符合新机构的监管权力与要求。

examples.en: Some critics argue that the regulatorship lacks transparency.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为这种监管体系缺乏透明度。

extraExplanation: “regulatorship”并不常见，更常见的表达是“regulatory authority / regulation / oversight / regulator’s role”。它由“regulator + -ship”构成，后缀“-ship”常表示“身份/职位/状态/制度”（如 friendship 友谊、leadership 领导层/领导力）。在正式或法律语境中偶尔会用来强调“监管者的身份与管辖权”。

summary.en: Regulatory means connected with official rules and their enforcement, often by government agencies.
summary.zh: Regulatory 指与官方监管规则及其执行有关，常由政府或监管机构实施。

definition.en: related to making or enforcing rules (especially by a government or official agency) to control how something is done
definition.zh: 与制定或执行规则有关的（尤指政府或主管机构为规范某事的方式而进行的管控）

examples.en: The company must meet regulatory requirements before selling the product.
examples.zh: 公司在销售该产品前必须满足监管要求。

examples.en: Regulatory agencies monitor the safety of medicines and food.
examples.zh: 监管机构监督药品和食品的安全。

extraExplanation: “Regulatory”常搭配：regulatory agency（监管机构）、regulatory requirements/standards（监管要求/标准）、regulatory framework（监管框架）、regulatory approval（监管批准）、regulatory compliance（合规）。
语感上，“regulatory”偏正式、偏公共事务语境，常见于金融、医药、环境、航空等行业；日常口语里更常说“rules”或“government rules”。
词源上来自 regulate（管理、调控）+ -ory（表示“与……有关的”形容词后缀），因此含义是“与管理/规制有关的”。

summary.en: A phrase for legally binding, rule-focused detailed planning (often in urban planning) that specifies what can be built and how.
summary.zh: 指以法律/政策约束为核心的详细规划，规定“能建什么、怎么建”（常用于城市规划语境）。

definition.en: (Urban planning / governance) detailed planning done to meet legal or policy requirements, specifying rules such as land use, building height, setbacks, density, and design standards.
definition.zh: （城市规划/治理）为满足法律或政策要求而进行的详细规划，明确土地用途、建筑高度、退线、容积率与设计标准等具体规定。

examples.en: The city approved the regulatory detailed planning for the new district, setting clear rules on building height and street width.
examples.zh: 市政府批准了新城区的管制性详细规划，明确了建筑高度和道路红线宽度等规则。

examples.en: Without regulatory detailed planning, developers may not know what they are allowed to build on each parcel of land.
examples.zh: 没有管制性详细规划，开发商可能不清楚每块地允许建设什么。

examples.en: Residents asked for stronger regulatory detailed planning to protect historic neighborhoods from oversized buildings.
examples.zh: 居民要求更严格的管制性详细规划，以保护历史街区不被超大体量建筑破坏。

extraExplanation: 这个短语更像“专业术语组合”，常见于城市规划文件与政府审批语境。英语里也常用更简洁的说法，如 regulatory plan、detailed regulatory plan，或用“zoning + regulations（分区与管控规定）”来表达类似含义。
如果你在翻译中文“控制/管制性详细规划”，在英美语境下往往会用 zoning plan / zoning regulations / development control plan（各地叫法不同）来对应；具体用哪一个取决于制度背景。

summary.en: A very rare (often humorous/archaic) noun meaning a female regulator—someone who controls or supervises.
summary.zh: 非常罕见（常带幽默/古风色彩）的名词，指“女监管者”，即负责管理、控制或监督的人。

definition.en: (Very rare, often humorous or archaic) A female regulator; a woman who regulates, controls, or supervises something.
definition.zh: （非常罕见，常带幽默或古风色彩）女监管者；负责管理、控制或监督事务的女性。

examples.en: In a playful tone, he called the strict dorm manager a “regulatress.”
examples.zh: 他用开玩笑的语气把严格的宿舍管理员称为“regulatress”。

examples.en: The novel’s narrator invents the word “regulatress” to describe a woman who keeps everyone in line.
examples.zh: 小说叙述者造了“regulatress”这个词来形容一位让大家守规矩的女性。

extraExplanation: “regulatress”由 regulate（管理、调节）+ -tress（传统上表示女性身份的后缀，如 actress）构成。但 -tress 在现代英语里常被视为过时或带性别刻板印象，因此现实写作中更常用 gender-neutral 的说法：regulator / supervisor / manager / official 等。
因为使用频率极低，它有时也可能被当作临时造词（nonce word）或戏仿用语；正式场合建议避免使用。

summary.en: Regulatrix is a rare, formal word meaning a female regulator or supervisor.
summary.zh: Regulatrix 是一个罕见、较正式的词，指女性的“监管者/管理者/监督者”。

definition.en: a woman who regulates, controls, or governs something; a female regulator (rare, formal).
definition.zh: （罕见、正式）指“女性的监管者/管理者/调节者”；女性的 regulator。

examples.en: In the novel, the regulatrix keeps strict order in the household.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这位女性管事（regulatrix）严格维持家中的秩序。

examples.en: The museum described her as a regulatrix of the early charity board.
examples.zh: 博物馆把她描述为早期慈善委员会的女性监管者。

definition.en: (historical) in ancient Rome, a female supervisor who maintained discipline or managed affairs (very rare usage).
definition.zh: （历史用法）古罗马中指负责维持纪律或管理事务的女性监督者（极罕见）。

examples.en: Some texts mention a regulatrix overseeing the training of attendants.
examples.zh: 一些文献提到有女性监督者（regulatrix）负责侍从的训练。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **regulatris** 很可能是拼写误差，更常见的形式是 **regulatrix**（单数）或 **regulatrices**（复数）。
在现代英语里更自然的说法通常是 **regulator**（不分性别）或 **supervisor/administrator** 等；**regulatrix** 带有“用拉丁式阴性词尾强调女性”的书面/历史色彩，因此较少见。

summary.en: *Regulatus* is a Latin word meaning “regulated; governed by rules,” not a common modern English word (English usually uses “regulated”).
summary.zh: *Regulatus* 是拉丁语词，意为“被规范的/受规则支配的”，不是现代英语常用词（英语通常用 regulated）。

definition.en: (Latin) “regulated; made orderly; governed by a rule.” It is the past participle form of the Latin verb *regulāre* (“to regulate”).
definition.zh: （拉丁语）“被规范的；被调节的；按规则治理的”。它是拉丁语动词 *regulāre*（“规范/调节”）的过去分词形式。

examples.en: In medieval texts, a community might be described as *regulatus*, meaning it was governed by a set of rules.
examples.zh: 在中世纪文本里，一个团体可能被写作 *regulatus*，意思是“按一套规章治理/管理”。

examples.en: Some scientific writing uses Latin words like *regulatus* to sound formal or traditional.
examples.zh: 一些科学写作会使用像 *regulatus* 这样的拉丁词，以呈现更正式或传统的风格。

definition.en: (Rare/technical) Used as a Latinized label or epithet in academic contexts (for example, in older scholarship or naming traditions), roughly meaning “the regulated one.”
definition.zh: （罕见/技术性）在学术语境中作为拉丁化标签或称谓（例如较早的学术写作或命名传统），大意为“那个被规范/被调节的（对象）”。

examples.en: A manuscript note might attach *regulatus* to a term to indicate it follows a standard form.
examples.zh: 手稿注释里可能在某个术语旁标注 *regulatus*，表示它采用了标准形式。

extraExplanation: *Regulatus* 不是现代英语里的常用词；现代英语通常直接用 **regulated**。如果你是在论文、碑铭、古籍、或生物/医学等领域里看到它，往往是为了沿用拉丁语传统。
词源上来自拉丁语 *regula*（规则、尺规），同源英语词包括 **rule, regulate, regular, regulation**。理解这个词时，把它当作“按规则整理好/被规则约束”的意思最稳妥。

summary.en: “Reguli” is mainly a Latin plural meaning “rules,” not a common modern English word.
summary.zh: “reguli”主要是拉丁语复数，意为“规则/准则”，并非常见现代英语词。

definition.en: (Not standard in modern English) A Latin plural form meaning “rules” or “guidelines,” sometimes seen in academic, legal, or motto-style contexts.
definition.zh: （现代英语中不算常用词）拉丁语复数形式，意思是“规则/准则”，有时会在学术、法律或格言式语境中出现。

examples.en: The manuscript lists several reguli for copying the text accurately.
examples.zh: 这份手稿列出了几条抄写文本时必须遵守的准则（reguli）。

examples.en: In older scholarly writing, you may see Latin terms like regula (rule) and its plural reguli.
examples.zh: 在较早的学术写作中，你可能会看到 regula（规则）及其复数 reguli 这样的拉丁语词。

extraExplanation: “reguli”更常见于拉丁语或受拉丁语影响的学术写作中：regula（规则）→ reguli（规则们/多条规则）。在日常英语里一般不会用“reguli”。

如果你本来想查的是英语单词，可能是拼写不完整或拼错了：
- regularly（经常地/有规律地）
- regulate（调节；管理；控制）
你可以告诉我你看到它的句子，我可以帮你确认具体是哪一个。

summary.en: “Reguline” is a rare, old word meaning “metallic (in pure metal form),” especially in older chemistry texts; it can also mean “regular/ruled.”
summary.zh: “reguline”是个少见的旧词，主要指“金属态的（纯金属形式）”，常见于早期化学文献；也可表示“规则的/有规可循的”。

definition.en: (Chemistry, old-fashioned) In a metallic state; not combined with other elements (for example, “reguline antimony” = metallic antimony).
definition.zh: （化学，旧式用法）处于金属状态的；未与其他元素化合的（例如“reguline antimony”指“金属态的锑”）。

examples.en: The text describes reguline antimony, meaning antimony in its metallic form.
examples.zh: 书中提到“reguline antimony”，意思是“金属态的锑”。

examples.en: In older chemistry writing, “reguline” often contrasts with “oxidized” or “combined.”
examples.zh: 在较早的化学著作里，“reguline”常与“氧化的”或“已化合的”相对。

definition.en: (Rare) Regular; ruled or ordered by fixed rules.
definition.zh: （罕见）规则的；受固定规则约束或安排的。

examples.en: The author praises the reguline rhythm of the verse.
examples.zh: 作者称赞诗句的节奏很“reguline”（规整有序）。

extraExplanation: “reguline”来自拉丁语“regulus”（小王、王侯；在炼金术/早期化学中也指“金属锭、金属块”的意思）。因此它常见于较旧的科学文献，用来表示“呈金属态（像金属块一样）”。
现代英语里这个词很少见；如果你是想表达“受规章管制的/按规定的”，更常用的是“regulatory”（监管的）或“regulated”（受管制的）。

summary.en: “Regulize” is usually a misspelling of “regularize,” meaning to make something standard, orderly, or officially legal.
summary.zh: “regulize”通常是“regularize”的误拼，意思是使某事标准化、有序化，或使其合法/正式化。

definition.en: Nonstandard spelling of “regularize”: to make something regular, standard, or legal/official.
definition.zh: “regularize”的非标准拼写：使某事变得有规律、标准化，或使其合法/正式化。

examples.en: The city wants to regularize street vending by offering permits.
examples.zh: 这座城市想通过发放许可证来规范街头摆摊。

examples.en: The company regularized its accounting process to reduce mistakes.
examples.zh: 公司把会计流程标准化，以减少错误。

extraExplanation: “regulize”在现代英语里通常被视为拼写错误或非常少见的变体；正式写作、考试、简历中建议使用“regularize”。
“regularize”常用于两类语境：①把流程/制度“规范化、标准化”（regularize a process/system）；②把身份/状态“合法化、转正”（regularize immigration status / employment).

summary.en: Regulus most commonly refers to the brightest star in Leo (Alpha Leonis). It can also refer to the Roman general Marcus Atilius Regulus.
summary.zh: Regulus 最常指狮子座最亮的恒星（轩辕十四/狮子座α星）。它也可指罗马将军马库斯·阿提利乌斯·雷古卢斯。

definition.en: A bright star (Alpha Leonis) in the constellation Leo, sometimes called “the Little King.”
definition.zh: 狮子座中最亮的恒星（轩辕十四，狮子座α星），有时被称为“小王”。

examples.en: Regulus is the brightest star in the constellation Leo.
examples.zh: 轩辕十四是狮子座中最亮的恒星。

examples.en: In spring nights, you can often spot Regulus near the sickle shape of Leo.
examples.zh: 春夜里，你常能在狮子座“镰刀”形状附近找到轩辕十四。

definition.en: A Roman name, especially of the general Marcus Atilius Regulus (3rd century BCE).
definition.zh: 罗马人的名字，尤指将军马库斯·阿提利乌斯·雷古卢斯（公元前3世纪）。

examples.en: Regulus is remembered in Roman history for his role in the First Punic War.
examples.zh: 雷古卢斯因在第一次布匿战争中的角色而被罗马史记载。
